loans.use:
purchase of condiments for re-sale

Achat de condiments alimentaires

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen is an enterprising woman with two children. Since she was no longer able to work, she decided to start a business to care for her children and support her husband with the household expenses since they are now paying for their home. She began her business a year a go with her mother's help. She started a grocery store and little by little the business has improved.

She is seeking a loan for $1,000, which she will repay in 6 months, to restock merchandise and to remodel some things in the store such as advertisements. With your help, Carmen will advance.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

Carmen es una mujer emprendedora tiene 2 hijos pequeños y decidió iniciar un negocio ya que ella ya no pudo trabajar para dedicarse al cuidado de sus hijos y para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ya que actualmente estan pagando su casa. Comenzó el negocio hace un año con la ayuda de su mamá, inicio la tienda de abarrotes y así poco a poco ha ido mejorando el negocio.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $1,000 que pagara en 6 meses para resurtir mercancía y también para remodelar algunas cosas de la tienda como anuncios. Con tu ayuda Carmen saldra adelante.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and remodel the store.

loans.name: Milka

texts.es:
Milka is a member of the "Solidarity" Communal Bank. She resides at Jr: Oscar R Benavides N º234 in the Callería District within the Ucayali region of Peru. She is 39 and widowed, with no children. She lives with her elderly parents, whom she assists.

Milka rents out 2 motorcars that are kept at her own home. She must wake every morning at 5:30am to tend to her chauffeurs and to give them the motorcars. Later, she prepares breakfast for her parents and provides care for her beloved mother, who suffers from arthritis.

With the requested loan of S/. 2,000, which is to be repaid in 5 months, she will buy 1 motorcar and renew her insurance policy and licenses.

Milka is a very giving woman, affectionate and a blessing to her parents. She is trustworthy and receives a strong endorsement in this opportunity offered to her by way of Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Milka pertenece al Banco Comunal “Solidaridad”, vive en el Jr: Oscar R Benavides N º234 del Distrito de Callería en el Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 39 años, es viuda y no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres ancianos a los cuales para asiste. Decide poner un negocio y para ello solicitó un préstamo de S/. 300.00 al Movimiento Manuela Ramos.

En la actualidad cuenta con 2 motokars , los cuales pone en alquiler, el lugar donde guarda es en su propio domicilio. Para lo cual se levanta todos los días a las 5:30am para atender a sus choferes y poder entregarles el motokar. Luego prepara el desayuno para sus padres y atiende en particular a su querida madre que padece de artritis.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará de 1 motokar y renovará el Soat (seguro de accidentes) y su tarjetas de circulación.

Milka es una mujer muy entregada, cariñosa y es una bendición para sus padres, se siente segura y con un buen respaldo por la oportunidad que le esta brindando Manuela Ramos.

loans.use:
Purchase of a motorcar
Compra de 1 motocar

loans.name: Caroline

texts.fr:
Born on 27 May 1970 in Cotonou, the economic capital of BENIN, Mrs. Caroline T. is married and has 4 children, of which the eldest, Yélian, is 12 years old in Class 5 (equivalent to 7th grade), and the youngest, Christella, is 4 years old and in preschool. She is a seamstress by profession and has been since 1992. But in parallel with this, she sells various items such as liquor, food pastes, detergents, and also pagnes (a West African type of cloth), which she delivers to her clients who come to her to have their clothes made. In order to respond to the needs of her clientele, she is asking for this loan, which is her second with the organization Alidé.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Née le 27 Mai 1970 à Cotonou dans la capitale économique du BENIN, dame T. Caroline est mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont l'aîné Yélian âgé de 12 ans est en classe de cinquième au cours secondaire et la benjamine Christella âgée de 04 ans est en classe de maternelle 2. Elle est couturière de profession et est en activité depuis 1992. Mais parallèlement à celle ci elle revend divers articles comme les liqueurs, des pâtes alimentaires, des détergents et aussi des pagnes qu'elle livre à ses clients qui viennent chez elle confectionner leurs habits. Afin de répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle, elle sollicite ce crédit qui est son deuxième prêt chez Alidé.

loans.use: To buy 20 pieces of Hitarget pagne cloth and 20 pieces of bazin (damask) cloth

loans.name: Sabougnouma (Porte Bonheur) Group

texts.fr:
The members of this Sabougnouma group are married women with an average age of 45 and on average, 8 children. They live in polygamous families with their husbands, co-spouses, brothers, sisters, parents-in-law, and children in the village of Sikouna 1, Sub-prefecture of Fana (Koulikoro Region, Republic of Mali).

This is a group that sells: condiments (salt, spices), edibles (shelled peanuts, cowpeas and cowpea flour, dah leaves for tea), locally produced soaps, cola nuts, etc.

Sabougnouma is bound by ties of neighborhood and friendship.

They do their shopping for condiments and cola nuts at the big market in Bamako and sometimes in Fana where locally produced soap is always available. They procure their foodstuffs right in Sikouna 1 and in the surrounding villages. They form a network of suppliers for the retailers of the villages who purchase from them on credit in their homes in the village. They also go to the weekly market fairs such as the one at Marka coungo (where lots of sales are made) where they retail goods on a cash basis.

This group’s clientele is essentially made up of retailers (women, men) and consumers. They expect to buy 15 kg of spices for 1800 FCFA each to be sold for 2500 FCFA the kilogram, i.e., at a profit of 10,500 FCFA, 50 kg of dried cowpeas at 11,000 FCFA to be sold at 20,000 FCFA, i.e., at a profit of 9000 FCFA, 1 kg of cola nuts at 2000 FCFA to be sold by the piece making a profit of 2000 FCFA.

The women of the group expect to make an average monthly profit of 10,000 FCFA with which they will make repayments on the loan and especially reinforce their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Les membres du groupe Sabougnouma sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’age de 45 ans et 8 enfants Elles vivent dans des familles polygames avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères, sœurs, beaux parents et enfants dans le village de Sikouna 1 sous préfecture de Fana (Région de Koulikoro République du Mali)

C’est un groupe qui fait le commerce de : condiments (sel de cuisine épices) denrées alimentaires (arachide décortiqué, graines et farine de niébé, du dah) savons de fabrication locale et de la cola etc.

Sabougnouma est essentiellement lié par des relations de voisinages et d’amitié.

Elles se ravitaillent au grand marché de Bamako pour les condiments, la cola et quelques fois à Fana ou le savon de fabrication locale s’y trouve en permanence .Pour les denrées alimentaires elles s’approvisionnent sur place à Sikouna 1 et dans les villages environnants. Elles forment un réseau de demi grossistes pour les détaillants des villages qui se ravitaillent généralement à crédit chez elles à domicile au niveau du village .Elles fréquentent aussi les foires hebdomadaires telles celle de Marka coungo (lieu de faire de bonnes affaires) ou les ventes se font au comptant et à détail.

La clientèle de ce groupe est essentiellement constituée de détaillants (femmes, hommes) et de consommateurs. Elles comptent acheter 15kg d’épices à 1800FCFA l’unité et vendus à 2500FCFA le kilogramme soit un bénéfice de 10500FCFA, 50 kg de niébé à11000FCFA et vendus à 20000FCFA soit 9000FCFA de bénéfice, 1kg de cola à 2000FCFAvendu à détail donne un bénéfice 2000FCFA.

Les femmes du groupe envisagent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 10000FCFAavec lequel elles vont payer les intérêts du prêt, et surtout renforcer leurs activités.

loans.use:
Purchase and re-sale of various items

Achat vente d’articles divers.

loans.name: Norma Lizeth

texts.es:
Norma is married and has two children who are very important to her. Therefore, she and her husband decided to start a hardware store, which now is very well stocked and is well situated in the city. She started this business to provided additional income because she and her family only counted on her husband's salary and they children were getting older and they were the majority of the household expenses. She began the business more than a year ago with her and her husband's savings.

She needs a $1,000 loan, which she will repay in 6 months, to restock her merchandise and to add new products. With your help, Norma will grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

Norma es casada y tiene dos hijos que son los mas importante para ella es por eso que entre su esposo y ella decidieron poner un negocio de ferretería el cual esta muy buen surtido y tiene muy buena ubicación en la cuidad. Inició el negocio para tener un ingreso adicional ya que solo contaban con el sueldo de su esposo y los hijos estaban creciendo y eran mayores los gastos de la casa. Comenzo el negocio hace mas de un año con los ahorros que tenian ella y su esposo.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $1,000 que pagara en 6 meses para resurtir mercancía y también para meter nuevos productos en el negocio. Con tu ayuda Norma hara crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and restock her hardware store.

loans.name: Carmen Rocio

texts.es:
Carmen belongs to “Las Azucenas II” Communal Bank located at Avenida Señor de los Milagros #190 in the Yarinacocha district of the state of Ucayali. She is 40 years old and the mother of three children. Her husband works at a petroleum distribution company.

With the first loan of 300 soles that Carmen received from Manuela Ramos she invested in beauty products. These products are from different lines (Avon, Unique, Esika, etc.) and she offers them door-to-door to an established clientele. To keep her clients happy she gives them small gifts that they appreciate.

With this loan of 1,200 soles, which she plans to repay in five months, she will buy perfumes, talcum powders, deodorants, earrings and lipsticks. She has a method of working in which she leaves her products with clients and then later charges them weekly and this works very well for her.

She is very satisfied with her business because she gives support to her husband and contributes to the livelihood of her family. Carmen is happy to receive loans because they are a great support for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Carmen pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Azucenas II, ubicado en la Av. Sr. de lo Milagros 190, del Distrito de Yarinacocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 40 años y es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo trabaja en un grifo, Carmen con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertir en productos de belleza. Estos productos son de diferentes líneas (Avon, Unique, Esika), ofrece de casa en casa ya tienen una cartera de clientes, para mantenerlos contentos a sus clientes les regala detalles que son apreciados por sus clientes. Con este préstamo recibido de S/ 1,200 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará perfumes, talcos, desodorante, aretes ropas y lápiz labial. Ella tiene una metodología de trabajo en la cual deja sus productos y luego cobra semanalmente, este método le resulta muy bien. Ella esta muy satisfecha con su negocio ya que de esa manera da un apoyo a su esposo para el sustento de su familia. Carmen esta feliz de recibir préstamos ya que son un gran apoyo para su familia.

loans.use: Purchase beauty products and accessories

loans.name: Sarakognouma (Bon Remboursement) Group

texts.fr:
The members of the Sarakognouma group are married women with an average age of 40 and an average of 6 children. They live in extended traditional families with their husbands, co-spouses, and children in the village of Djinina, Sub-prefecture of Fana (Koulikoro Region, Republic of Mali).

This group deals in: charcoal, condiments and various small items such as peanuts, guinea fowl eggs, epinares, baobab leaves, etc.

They met because of professional reasons, because they live near each other, or are relatives. In searching for business capital, the members of the Sarakognouma group decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso with whom they have just received a first loan. Sarakognuoma are a group of retailers, plain and simple, who stock up on condiments exclusively on weekly market days in Fana, buying from wholesalers who come from Bamako, Ségou, Dioila, or from those living in Fana itself. They purchase smaller items in the village and surrounding areas or get them in the countryside (by harvesting them) or collect guinea fowl eggs along the edges of the fields. They sell essentially out of their houses in the village, retail and on a cash basis and also on credit.

The members of the Sarakognouma group intend to buy with this loan: 50 kg of condiments (composed of various sorts used in preparing dishes) at 1500 FCFA the kilogram and re-selling in small quantities making a monthly average profit margin of 30,000 FCFA which will be used to make repayments on the loan and to invest in their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Les membres du groupe Sarakognouma sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’age de 40 ans et 6 enfants Elles vivent dans des familles élargies traditionnelles avec leurs maris, coépouses et enfants dans le village de Djinina sous préfecture de Fana (Région de Koulikoro République du Mali)

Ce groupe exerce le commerce de : charbon de bois de condiments et divers petits articles : arachides, œufs de pintade, epinares, feuilles de baobab etc.

Elles se sont connues par des relations d’ordre professionnel de voisinage et de parenté. Dans leurs recherches de fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe Sarakognouma ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles viennent de bénéficier d’un premier prêt. Sarakognuoma est vraiment un groupe de pures détaillantes qui s’approvisionnent en condiments exclusivement les jours de marchés hebdomadaires de Fana auprès de grossistes qui viennent de Bamako Ségou Dioila et résident à Fana même .Quant aux divers elles s’approvisionnent sur place au village et environs soit en brousse (activité de cueillettes) soit le ramassage des œufs de pintades au abords des champs. Elles vendent essentiellement à domicile (au village) en détail au comptant et aussi à crédit.

Les membres du groupe Sarakognouma comptent acheter avec ce prêt : 50 kg de condiments (composés de différentes sortes toutes dans la préparation des plats alimentaires) à 1500FCFA le kilogramme et revendus à détail dégage une marge bénéficiaire mensuelle et moyenne de 30000FCFA qui servira à payer les intérêts du prêt et investir dans les activités.

loans.use:
Purchase and re-sale of diverse items

Achat vente d’articles divers

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr:
Born on 27 December 1995 in ALLADA in the Atlantique department in the south of BENIN, Mrs. Jeanne HOUNTO is married and has 3 children : Douglas, a 28 year old agronomist, Sylviane, 18 years old and in the second class (equivalent to 10th grade), and James, 12 years old and in the CM2 class (equivalent to 3rd grade). She is a weaver by profession and has been so for 15 years. She began selling ready-to-eat meals about 1 year ago because she has always wanted to break new ground and start many different business activities. With the hope of meeting her current financial needs and to satisfy the demands of her customers, she is asking for her second loan, a sum of 100,000 francs.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Née le 27 Décembre 1955 à ALLADA dans le département de l'Atlantique au sud du BENIN, dame HOUNTO Jeanne est mariée et mère de 03 enfants: Douglas 28 ans Agronome,Sylviane 18 ans en classe de seconde au cours secondaire et James 12 ans en classe de CM2 au cours primaire. Elle est tisserande de profession et exerce cette activité depuis 15 ans.Elle s'est mise dans la vente de repas prêt à manger il y a environ 01 an car elle a sans cesse voulu innover et entreprendre plusieurs activités. Dans le souci de faire face au besoin de financement actuel et de satisfaire à la demande de sa clientèle, elle sollicite pour son deuxième crédit une somme de 100 000 francs.

loans.use: To buy 3 boxes of sewing thread, 4 bags of rice, and 1 can of vegetable oil

loans.name: Roxana Luisa

texts.es:
Roxana belongs to the “Mujeres Audaces” Communal Bank located at Avenida 21 de octubre #102 in the Callería district of the state of Ucayali. She is 23 years old, the mother of two minor children and is married.

Roxana had the intention of supporting her husband and for that reason decided to invest in an Internet cafe business. She did that with her first loan of 300 soles from Manuela Ramos. Nowadays she has a business offering Internet access from cubicles installed in her own home. In addition to running the business she continues doing the household chores. She gladly does this because another thing she values is the opportunity to have lunch each day with her entire family.

With this loan of 900 soles, which she plans to repay in five months, she will invest in purchasing three Web cams, five mice, replacement computer parts and five Playstation accessories.

Effort and dedication motivate her every day to be a strong woman and she is thankful to life for having a united family and the support of her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Roxana pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Audaces” domiciliada en la Av: 21 de octubre Nº 102 del Distrito de Callería en el Departamento de Ucayali tiene 23 años, es madre de 2 hijos menores y está casada. Roxana tenía la intención de apoyar a su esposo por ello decide invertir en el negocio de alquiler de cabinas de Internet y esto lo efectúa con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300. En la actualidad cuenta con un negocio de servicio de alquiler de cabinas de internet instalado en su propio domicilio. Paralelamente a la atención del negocio sigue haciendo las labores de la casa, ella gustosa lo efectúa porque algo que valora es que tiene la oportunidad de compartir todos los días el almuerzo con toda la familia. Con este préstamo de S/. 900 soles, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de 3 Web Cam, 5 Mouse, repuestos de computadora y 5 mandos para playtashion. El esfuerzo y dedicación que cada día le motiva a ser de ella una mujer luchadora y agradece a la vida de tener una familia unida y cuenta con el apoyo de esposo.

loans.use: Purchase computer accessories and parts

loans.name: Asteria

texts.es:
Asteria is 39 years old and a mother of 5 school age children, the oldest of who helps her in her business. Asteria makes and sells delicious ice cones (ice and fruit syrup) and refreshments, which are consumed often in the hot climate of the area. Mrs. Asteria’s husband is a teacher at a high school and together they move their home forward and provide for the needs of their children in the hopes of having a happy life. The dream of this mother is to have a small ice cream store. She is coming to you asking for a loan to be able to build a stand from which she can sell her refreshments and ice cones and make her customers and herself more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Asteria es una madre de 39 años y 5 hijos, en edad escolar, el mayor de ellos le ayuda en su negocio. Asteria se dedica a la elaboración y venta de deliciosas raspadillas (hielo y jarabe de fruta) y refresco, muy consumidos por el clima cálido de la zona.El esposo de doña Asteria es profesor en un gimnasio y juntos sacan adelante a su hogar y proveen las necesidades de sus hijos, en espera de que vivan felices. El sueño de esta madre es tener una pequeña heladería. Ella recurre a ustedes en solicitud de un préstamo para construir un kiosko, para la venta de sus refrescos y raspadillas, y así brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes y a ella misma.

loans.use: Build a stand for the sale of refreshments and ice cones.

loans.name: Desarrollo Y Progreso Group

texts.en: Ercilia M. is the leader of her Esperanza International Bank of Hope, Desarrollo y Progreso ("Development and Progress").  She is the mother of four--aged 6,11,13, and 15--and has used her loan to open her shop "Novedades Ercilia," which sells clothes and novelties.  With her future loans she hopes to expand her business and offer her loyal customers more merchandise so that she can ensure that her children are never lacking anything.

loans.use: growing Novedades Ercilia (sale of clothes, food, etc.)

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana is the owner of a mototaxi and also sells chickens. She has two minor children who are still in school. Her husband José is the one in charge of the care of the mototaxi and he uses it to transport passengers. These two parents dedicate their efforts to their children’s future, and both of them know that the children depend on them to become good men. Susana has turned to you to request a loan for which part will be used to repair the mototaxi and the other part will be used to increase their capital for their chicken business. In the future, they want to build their own stall where they can sell their chickens and be more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Susana es propietaria de un motocarro, y también se dedica a la venta de pollo, ella tiene 2 hijos menores que aún estudian. Su esposo el señor José es quien se dedica al cuidado de su motocarro y lo maneja haciendo transporte de pasajeros. Estos dos padres dedican su esfuerzo para el futuro de sus hijos, ambos saben que de ellos depende que sean hombres de bien.Susana se dirige a ustedes para solicitar un préstamo, el cual usará para la reparación de su motocarro y otra parte para incrementar el capital de su negocio de pollo, para en un futuro poder construir su propio puesto de venta y tener una mayor comodidad.

loans.use: Repair their mototaxi and have more capital for their chicken business

loans.name: Leni Beatriz

texts.es:
Leni belongs to the “Mujeres Audaces” Communal Bank located at Jr. Roca Fuerte #421 in the Callería district of the state of Ucayali. She is 42 years old, the mother of three minor children and her husband is employed. Leni sees the necessity of having a business and so with the first loan of 300 soles received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in the business of renting Internet booths installed in her own home. Besides the business, she attends to all of the household chores and takes her children to school. Her daily routine is very tiring but at the end of the day she feels satisfied because she sees herself as an accomplished woman, mother and wife.

With this loan of 1,500 soles, which she plans to repay in five months, she will invest in five Web cams, two used computers and a printer.

Every day Leni is growing as a businesswoman and she feels happy because she is providing for the necessities of her children. She is thankful for the immense support that Manuela Ramos gives to her.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Leni pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Audaces” domiciliada en el Jr: Roca Fuerte Nº 421 del Distrito de Callería en el Departamento de Ucayali tiene 42 años, es madre de 3 hijos menores, su esposo es empleado. Leny ve la necesidad de un negocio, es así que con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300 soles decidió invertir en el negocio de alquiler de cabinas de Internet. En la actualidad cuenta con su negocio de alquiler de cabinas de internet instalado en su propio domicilio. Leni además del negocio atiende todos los quehaceres de la casa y lleva a los hijos al colegio, realmente su rutina es muy agotadora, pero al final del día se siente satisfecha porque se ve realizada como mujer, madre y esposa. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de 5 Web Cam, 2 computadoras de segunda mano y 1 impresora. Leni cada día esta creciendo como empresaria se siente muy feliz porque esta aportando en las necesidades que puedan tener sus hijos agradece por el apoyo inmenso que Manuela Ramos le brinda.

loans.use: Purchase five Web cams, two used computers and a printer

loans.name: Ines

texts.en:
Ines is the mother of four and grandmother of 14. She lives with her daughter and two grandchildren in the province of El Seibo. Ines works as a cleaning lady in both homes and buildings. The government pays her for cleaning large government buildings. Its hard for her to clean sometimes because the buildings are so tall and the windows and walls are very high up.

With this loan, Ines plans to start a small business selling food that she will cook herself. Here, such a business is called a ¨fritura,¨where all sorts of snacks and homemade food are prepared and sold. With the profits from the fritura, Ines hopes to one day buy a stove for her house. She would also love to install a glass window to keep out the flies and mosquitoes. Glass windows are very rare here and quite a luxury, so this is a big dream for her.

loans.use: To start up a small snack stand

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara belongs to Banco Comunal Las Asucenas II, located in Jr Bellavista, block 9 post 32 in the Calleria District in the Ucayali Department. She is 47 years old and is mother to three children. With her first loan of S. 300 from Manuela Ramos, Clara invested in her beauty shop. Her shop is located in the city center and has many customers who know that Clara can provide beautiful hairstyles, as well as provide in-home services.

With this loan of S. 1,500, which will be repaid in five months, Clara will purchase shampoo, dyes, and other hair products. Clara is very charismatic and attends to all customers who come to her beauty shop. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos movement for the backing provided.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Clara pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Azucenas II, ubicado en el Jr Bellavista cdra. 9 puesto 32, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 47 años y es madre de 3 hijos. Clara con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en su peluquería. Su Peluquería queda en el centro de la ciudad y tiene muchos clientes que saben que Clara les hace C., peinados bonitos, ademas da sus servicios a domicilio.. Con este préstamo recibido de S/ 1,500 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará champú, tintes y líquidos para peinados. Clara es muy carismática para atender a todos(as) sus clientes que llegan a su peluquería, para ser atendidas por ella. Y agradece a movimiento Manuela Ramos por el respaldo que le brinda.

loans.use: Purchase various items for a beauty shop.

loans.name: Fuente De Esperanza (Source Of Hope) Group 8

texts.en:
Francisca B. lives with her parents, her husband, and her two children, ages three and six. She is currently 4 months pregnant with her third child. She owns and cooks in a small “fritura” where she sells fried foods like empanadas along with other snacks. While she’s at work, her 6 year-old goes to school and the 3 year-old stays at home with her parents. Francisca has successfully repaid three loans to Esperanza International and is currently applying for her fourth.

Francisca has great ambitions for the future. She wants to expand her business so that she will have money to pursue many dreams. She has completed her first year of high school and, though she is not currently in school, she hopes to go back and finish her diploma. She would love to be able to have her own house for her family. She also dreams of being able to send her three kids through school all the way to college so that they can have professional careers.

Note: Mariana Isa was not able to come because her niece was very sick, so her husband appears in this photo in her place.

Note: This is a group loan for 5 people.

loans.use: To grow her business selling fried foods

loans.name: Mirela

texts.es:
Mírela belongs to “Las Azucenas II” Communal Bank located at Jr. Yarina Cocha, Mz. B Lt. 7, in the Yarina Cocha district of the state of Ucayali. She is 20 years old and single. With the first loan received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles, Mírela started a business selling candies. She also works in an accounting firm which enables her to bring additional income to her family while receiving the support of her mother who takes care of her business until she returns.

With this loan of 1,000 soles, which she plans to repay in five months, she will buy five cases of cookies, five bags of lollipops, one bag of “chisitos,” one case of gum, one bag of toilet paper and three cases of soft drinks.

Mírela is a very enthusiastic young lady with a lot of desire to get ahead, both professionally and economically, as she is a help to her parents. She is very happy to be a part of the Manuela Ramos bank.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

La señorita Mírela pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Azucenas II, ubicado en el Jr. Yarina cocha Mz.B Lt.7, Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 20 años es soltera, Mirela con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 implemento su negocio en venta de golosinas. Mírela también trabaja en un estudio contable y es así que trae un ingreso mas a su familia ella recibe el apoyo de su mama ya que ella queda a cargo de su negocio hasta que ella regrese.. Con este préstamo recibido de S/ 1,000 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 5 cajas de galletas 5 bolsas de chupetines, 1 bolsa de chisito, 3 tiras de ch, 1 caja de chicle ice, 1 bol. papel higiénico, 3 paquetes de Gaseosas, Mirela es una señorita muy entusiasta tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante tanto en lo profesional y económicamente; ya que ella es un apoyo para sus padres y esta muy contenta de participar en el Banco Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase candies and soft drinks at wholesale prices

loans.name: Mujeres De Debora Group

texts.en:
Lucelia C. runs a small cafeteria in the little community of Llano De Perre, Dominican Republic. As a single mother of three, the income from this mini-restaurant is the livelihood of her family. She sought out Esperanza to help her with her first ever loan, valuing $150. The money that Lucelia gets from this loan will go towards purchasing bread, meat, oil, and fresh fruit to make smoothies at her local venue. In typical Dominican fashion, her favorite dish is rice, beans, and chicken, a customer favorite as well. She dreams of one day being able to travel outside of the country with her three children.

Lucelia is one of the leaders of the 15-person micro-bank Mujeres de Debora. Many of the women in this 15-person bank have recently immigrated from Haiti in search of a better future. Their businesses are simple, but offer a stream of income that could never have been accomplished without such a loan for initial capital. Several of the women sell clothes and shoes in the street, while others go from office to office vending fresh fruit and vegetables daily. These unique entrepreneurs have united in solidarity, allowing them to access funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own.

The concept of this group bank repaying their loan together is to reduce the risk of one person defaulting, as the other members gladly help cover one another’s payments in order to receive their next loan together. As these 15 entrepreneurs embark upon their first ever loan from Esperanza, we are confident that they will all succeed in bettering their lives and the lives of their families with this loan.

On behalf of Lucelia C., the Mujeres de Debora group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support and awareness of the global issue of poverty, where your efforts are helping to make a difference.

loans.use: To purchase meat, bread, fruit, and a blender for a small restaurant

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris is 41 years old. Together with her husband she makes a living selling fish. While he travels selling, she sets up in front of the door to her house, where she sells fresh and salted fish on a table that she places there. This couple works hard to be able to cover the expenses of their home and the education of their children. Because of the intense heat, she is in need of a loan to be able to construct what in her area is called a “ramada”, which is a covering made of branches woven together, and will be placed over her selling area as a form of roof. She needs to purchase the materials and is counting on you to enable her to do so.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Doris tiene 41 años, ella y su esposo se dedican a la venta de pescado, mientras que él se va por diferentes lugares para vender, ella se acomoda en la puerta de su casa, y en una mesa acomoda su pescado fresco y salado. Esta pareja se esfuerza en su trabajo para cumplir con los gastos de su casa y el estudio de sus hijos.Por el intenso calor ella se ve en la necesidad de pedir este préstamo para la elaboración de lo que llaman en su localidad, una ramada, que es una especie de trenzado de ramas en plancha, para colocarlo como techo del espacio donde vende, necesita comprar esos materiales y confía en ustedes para ello.

loans.use: Purchase of materials to construct a shelter of branches to cover the area where she sells fish.

loans.name: Alida

texts.es:
Mrs. Alida is a woman with a strong drive to overcome her obstacles and progress. She sells cold beverages ( sodas and beer) and also when requested she prepares meals in the evening. Alida is 59 years old and mother of 9 daughters, four of whom are independent. and have their own families. Five are still single, work and still live with her. Her husband Julio is a farmer, and they both support each other in their work. Alida wants to better supply and expand her business and be able to bring more variety to her customers. She needs a loan to realize her goal.

Translated from Sapnish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Alida es una mujer con muchos deseos de superación y progreso, se dedica a la venta de bebidas heladas (gaseosas y cervezas), y aparte cuando se lo piden, también vende comida por las noches. Alida tiene 58 años y es madre de 9 hijas siendo cuatro de ellas ya independientes y de familia, mientras que 5 son aún solteras, trabajan, pero todavía viven con ella, su esposo, Julio, es agricultor y ambos se apoyan en sus labores.Alida quiere implementar y ampliar su negocio para brindar a sus clientes una mejor acogida, necesita de un préstamo para realizar su propósito.

loans.use: Investment capital to increase inventories and expand her business.

loans.name: Betman

texts.es:
Betman is 25 years old. He works as a taxi driver and in agriculture with the help of his wife. They have a small child and both work hard in order to give him all the necessities, especially an education. Betman is the driver of a mototaxi, which is having mechanical issues. As a result, he is relying on you to provide him with a loan so he may repair his mototaxi, as well as invest in his farmland for a better harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Betman tiene 25 años, trabaja en el transporte de pasajeros, y en la agricultura con la ayuda de su esposa, tienen un pequeño hijo, y ambos trabajan duro para darle lo necesario, en especial para los gastos estudiantiles. Betman es dueño de un motocarro, el que está presentando fallas mecánicas, por lo que recurre a ustedes para que le brinden un préstamo con el que pueda reparar su motocarro e invertir en sus tierras de cultivo para una mejor cosecha.

loans.use: Repair his mototaxi.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Rita makes a living by selling fruit at a stand in the market. The change in the climate in her area has compromised her products; there have been many losses and shortages. For this reason she has moved away from this business and until the situation improves is working in the sale of animals (chickens, ducks, turtles and such). Rita has five children, and both her and her husband work to be able to give them what is necessary. One of Rita’s dreams is that her children will someday become professionals; another is to be able to construct a home of quality materials. For these reasons she is requesting your support in the acquisition of a loan that she will use to purchase more animals thus increasing her sales and her income. She is anxiously waiting for her acceptance.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Rita se dedica a la venta de frutas en un puesto del mercado, pero por el cambio de clima en su zona a perjudicado mucho sus productos, ha habido también muchas pérdidas y una gran escasez por ello ha dejado de lado esta actividad y hasta que mejore la situación está trabajando en la venta de animales (gallinas, patos, motelos y otras variedades) Rita tiene 5 hijos, y tanto ella como su esposo trabajan para darles lo necesario. Uno de los sueños de Rita es que sus hijos sean algún día profesionales, y el otro es poder construir su casa con material noble. Para ello pide su apoyo con un préstamo que utilizará en la compra de más animales para aumentar su venta y con ello sus ganancias. Espera con ansias su aceptación.

loans.use: Capital for the purchase of more animals for later resale in the market of the area.

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
Jesus is 38 years old and is dedicated to transporting passengers in his mototaxi. With help from his wife, he cultivates a small plot of land and sells produce. In this manner, this couple is able to pay their bills and support their children's education. The reason why Jesus is here in front of you is so he may request a loan so he can maintain his mototaxi and purchase some parts. At the same time, he wants to continue saving for the purchase of another vehicle so he may increase his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Jesús tiene 38 años, y se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en motocarro, a la par con la ayuda de su esposa, cultivan un pequeño terreno para luego vender los productos producidos, de esta manera, esta pareja de esposos sostienen los gastos de su casa y los estudios de sus hijos.El motivo por el que Jesús se presenta ante ustedes es para pedir un apoyo económico en préstamo para el mantenimiento de su motocarro y la compra de algunos repuestos, así mismo seguir ahorrando para la compra de otro vehículo para aumentar sus ganancias.

loans.use: Mototaxi maintenance and the purchase of parts.

loans.name: Geysi

texts.es:
Geysi has a small glass shop. She began selling paintings and now she has her own business, which makes her feel happy and proud. Geysi is 26 years old and has three children. Her husband is a carpenter and together they take care of their family's needs. She thinks that this project of helping people get ahead is a great idea: If there were more groups around the world working so that others can progress, the world would be a better place. She is thankful for the assistance that you can provide and feels emotional to think that, of all the people in the world, she may receive a friendly helping hand. Geysi promises to be punctual and responsible with her payments. The money that she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of materials for her glass shop and to improve the space that she uses.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Geysi tiene una pequeña vidriería, ella empezó vendiendo cuadros y ahora ha logrado tener su propio negocio por el que se siente muy feliz y orgullosa. Geysi tiene 26 años y 3 hijos, su esposo es maderero y juntos sostienen las necesidades familiares. Ella considera que este proyecto donde personas ayudan a otras a salir adelante es una gran idea, ya que si hubieran más grupos trabajando para que otros progresen el mundo sería un lugar mejor. Por ello que agradece el apoyo que le puedan brindar y se siente emocionada al pensar en la gente en todo el mundo, que como ella puede recibir una mano amiga.Ella promete ser puntual y responsable en sus pagos, y el dinero solicitado será invertido en la compra de materiales para su vidriería y para la mejora del espacio que utiliza.

loans.use: Investment capital for her glass business.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara belongs to “Las Azucenas II” Communal Bank located in the Unión de Damnificados neighborhood of Callería in the state of Ucayali. She is 42 years old and the mother of three children. Her husband is an electrical technician.

With the first loan of 300 soles that Sara received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in the purchase of products for a grocery store. Nowadays she continues to sell groceries and little by little is introducing hardware items. In the evenings she receives additional income selling foods typical of the region and is very happy because she is progressing. With this loan of 1,800 soles, which she plans to repay in five months, she will buy three sacks of rice, three sacks of sugar, two cases of milk and some hardware items. Sara feels very grateful to the Manuela Ramos bank because thanks to it, she can continue to grow her business. She has the desire to continue growing until she has her own bookstore and mini hardware store.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Sara pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Azucenas II , ubicado en el AA.HH Unión de Damnificados Mz.B Lt.8, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 42 años es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es Técnico Electricista. Sara con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/.300 decidió invertir en la compra de productos de abarrotes. En la actualidad continua con su venta de productos de abarrotes y esta implementándose poco a poco en lo que es ferretería; por las noches también tiene otro ingreso vende comida lo que son comidas regionales y que esta muy contenta por que esta progresando. Con este préstamo recibido de S/ 1,800 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 3 sacos de arroz, 3 sacos de azúcar, 2 caja de leche, y un poco de ferretería Sara se siente muy agradecida con el Banco Manuela Ramos ya que gracias a ello puede seguir creciendo su negocio ella tiene toda esperanza de seguir creciendo hasta lograr formar su librería y mini ferretería.

loans.use: Purchase products for a general store at wholesale prices

loans.name: Sonia Luz

texts.es:
Ms. Sonia belongs to the bank Banco Comunal Las Azucenas II, located in Jr. Emancipación Mz.F Lt.18, in the District of San Fernando, Department of Ucayali. She’s 42 years old and has one child. Her husband works as a personal assistant. Sonia was able to stock her clothing business with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos S./300 (300 soles, Peruvian currency). She also provides tailoring services. With this loan in the amount of 1,500 soles, which will be repaid in 5 moths, she will invest in purchasing material by the meter, 12 shoe sole inserts, 6 pairs of jeans, 12 blouses and 5 sets children’s clothing. Sonia is very happy with the bank Banco Manuela Ramos because thanks to them business is increasing. She hopes to buy a display case so that she can sell jewelry, perfume and to better display her products.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Sonia pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Azucenas II, ubicado en el Jr. Emancipación Mz.F Lt.18, Distrito de san fernando del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 42 años y tiene un solo hijo y su esposo es Asistente Personal, Sonia con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 implemento su negocio de venta de ropas. También brinda servicio de costura. Con este préstamo recibido de S/ 1,500 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, ella invierto comprando telas por metros, 12 plantilla de zapatos, 6 pantalones jean, 12 blusas y 5 conjuntos para niños. Sonia esta muy contenta con el Banco Manuela Ramos por que gracias a ello su negocio esta surgiendo. Ella tiene toda la esperanza de comprarse su vitrina para que así que venda sus joya, perfumería y para que así pueda tener mejor exhibición sus productos.

loans.use: To buy clothing and material at wholesale price.

loans.name: Teresa Mercedes

texts.es:
Ms. Teresa belongs to the bank Banco Comunal Las Azucenas. She lives in Jr. Contamana #183, District of Yarina Cocha, Department of Ucayali. She’s 52 years old and she has 5 children. Her husband is an electrician. With the first Manuela Ramos loan of S/.300 (300 soles, Peruvian currency) received, she decided to purchase Unique and Avon brand cosmetics. AsiD. from selling cosmetics, she makes additional income as a fast food street vendor in the evenings, selling items such as salchipapas (a potato and sausage dish and sandwiches). Her business is doing well. With this 1,800 Soles loan, which will be repaid in 4 moths, she will stock her business, buy a display case for her cosmetics, purchase perfumes, deodorants, cologne, talcum powders, jewelry, etc. Teresa is very happy with the loan she received since it helped her business grow, in this way reaching her goals and dreams. Teresa wants to sell cards and cell phones. In this ways she will be able to pay for her children’s education especially for one of her children who is studying at university.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Teresa pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Azucenas, vive en el Jr. Contamana #183, del Distrito D. YarinaCocha del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 52 años y es madre D. 5 hijos, su esposo es Electricista. Con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 decidió invertir en la compra D. productos D. belleza D. las marcas Unique y Avon. Ademas D. la venta D. productos D. belleza, por las noches también tiene otro ingreso adicional, ella venD. comida rápida en forma ambulante, como por ejemplo salchipapas y sandwich’s. Le está yendo bastante bien. Con este préstamo D. S/ 1,800 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, implementó su negocio, compró una vitrina para que pueda exhibir sus productos D. belleza, también comprará perfumes, desodorantes, colonias, talcos, joyas, etc. Teresa se siente muy bien con el préstamo recibido por que le ayuda a seguir creciendo su negocio, y así pueD. cumplir sus metas y sus sueños. Teresa quiere vender tarjetas y celulares; y así pueda ayudarle a pagar sus estudios a sus hijos sobre todo a uno que esta en la universidad.

loans.use: To buy a display case and cosmetics.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es:
Violeta belongs to the bank Banco Comunal “Solidaridad”, her home is located in Jr: libertad Nº 1182, District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She’s 47 years old and is the mother of 4 children, 3 older children, and 1 underage child. She is married and her husband is a teacher. Violeta with the goal of feeling like a sense of accomplishment hopes to take secure a loan from Manuela Ramos in the amount of 300 Soles (Peruvian currency) to sell ice. She currently has 2 refrigerators to sell ice and since she is close to the market, the salespeople are her clients. As additional income she rents out her mini-gym. Violeta wakes up at 5 am to get ready for the day, with her husband, because she also works as advocate for Pronoi, an educational center. She returns at 1 pm to begin work in her business. With this loan of 1,300 Soles, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy a thousand bags and will fix her freezer, which is in need of repair due to the high demand. Violeta is very happy because she started slowly, and her biggest wish is to make her business larger and be a great businesswoman. This is why she is very grateful to Manuela Ramos, who has given her the opportunity to secure a credit for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

Violeta pertenece al Banco Comunal “Solidaridad”, su domicilio esta ubicado Jr: libertad Nº 1182, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 47 años y es madre de 4 hijos 3 adultos y 1menor de edad, está casada y su esposo es docente (profesor). Violeta con la finalidad de sentirse realizada decide hacer un préstamo a Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 para vender hielo. En la actualidad cuenta con 2 refrigeradoras para vender sus hielos ya que esta cerca al mercado y los vendedores son sus clientes. Así mismo alquila su mini gimnasio, es otro ingreso más. Violeta tiene que levantarse a las 5.00 a.m. para alistarse juntamente con su esposo porque también trabaja como promotora de Pronoi (Centro educativo), esta de regreso a la 1:00pm lista para atender su negocio. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,300 soles, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 1 millar de bolsas e invirtirá en la reparación de su congelador pues, es necesario darle mantenimiento por la mucha demanda que tiene. Violeta esta muy contenta, por que empezó de poco a poco y su mas grande deseo es ampliar su negocio y ser una gran empresaria, por ello esta muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos que le brindo la oportunidad a un crédito para su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase plastic bags and to fix a freezer.

loans.name: Diolizana

texts.es:
Diolizana belongs to the bank Banco Comunal “Las Golondrinas 2”. She lives in Jr: Zavala Nº 775, District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She’s 37 years old and is the mother of 3 young children, and her husband is a laborer. Diolizana has decided to ask for a loan of 300 soles from Manuela Ramos to invest and open a multi-services business: providing photocopies, lamination, notebooks, and digitizing of documents. She currently maintains a business in her own home, allowing her to do home chores, but besides all this work, she able to take a small break from 1 to 4 pm. With this loan of 2,000 soles (Peruvian currency), which will be repaid in 4 moths, she will invest in the purchase of supplies: 2 thousand sheets of bond paper, 3 printer ink cartridges, 20 laminate sheets, 25 notebooks, 50 manila folders, 50 poster boards. Diolinzana is very happy because she contributes to the household income and her biggest wish is to grow as a businesswoman and she thanks Manuela Ramos for the support they have given.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

Diolizana pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Golondrinas 2”domiciliada en el Jr: Zavala Nº 775 del Distrito de Callería en el Departamento de Ucayali tiene 37 años, es madre de 3 hijos menores, su esposo es obrero. Diolizana decide hacer un préstamo de Manuela Ramos S/ 300.para invertir y abrir un negocio de Multiservicios: fotocopias, enmicados, espiralados y digitación de trabajos. En la actualidad cuenta con su negocio en su propio domicilio, esto le permite ver los quehaceres de la casa, a pesar de todo el trajín, ella puede darse un pequeño descanso de 1.00 pm hasta las 4.00pm Con el este préstamo de S/. 2,000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra de insumos: 2 millares de papel bond, 3 tintas para impresora, 25 micas, 25 espirales, 50 fólderes de Manila y 50 cartulinas. Diolizana se siente muy contenta porque apoya en los gastos que tiene en su hogar y su mayor anhelo es crecer como empresaria y agradece a Manuela Ramos por el apoyo brindado

loans.use: To purchase supplies (paper, ink, lamination supplies, poster board etc.)

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Ms. Esther belongs to the bank Banco Comunal Mujeres Audaces, located in Jr. Manco capac #151 in the town of Joven Bellavista, District of San Fernando, Department of Ucayali. She is 60 year old and is the mother of 4 children, and she is a widow. With the first loan of 300 Soles (Peruvian currency) she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to continue investing in her banana business. She currently continues to sell bananas at wholesale and individual prices in the Bellavista Market and bijao leaf (a type of leaf similar to banana leaf). She works from 5 am to 6:30 pm and she also sells her banana fritters. With this loan of 2,000 Soles, which will be repaid in 5 month, she will buy banana bunches and bijao laves at wholesale prices. Esther, despite her ages is a strong woman who doesn’t tire, and she continues to move ahead despite the obstacles she has faced.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Esther pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Audaces, ubicado en el Jr. Manco capac #151 Pueblo Joven Bellavista, Distrito de San Fernando del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 60 años y es madre de 4 hijos, es viuda. Esther con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió seguir implementando su negocio de venta de plátanos. En estos momentos sigue con la venta de plátanos al por mayor y menor en el mercado bellavista y venta de hoja de bijao. Sale a vender a las 5:00 am hasta las 6:30 pm y ahí aprovecha también en vender sus chifles (Plátano frito). Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará racimos de plátanos y hoja de bijao al por mayor.. Esther a su edad es una mujer muy luchadora que no desmaya y sigue adelante a pesar de los tropiezos que ella tuvo.

loans.use: To purchase bananas and bijao leaves at wholesale price.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Lilian belongs the bank Banco Comunal “Solidaridad”, her home is located in the Municipal city of 6 de Diciembre Mz A Lt 1, District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 43 years old and she is the mother of 3 children, 1 older child and 2 younger ones. Her husband is employed. Lilian wants to help out economically at home, and because of this she has asked for a loan of 300.00 Soles (Peruvian currency) from Manuela Ramos. She currently runs a small clothing sales business and she travels once a month to the city of Tacna to buy clothing. She wakes up every day at 6 am to go to the market and leaves everything ready at home, so she can run her business. Lilian delivers ordered clothing from 10 am until 1pm, when she rests and eats. She continues working from 5 pm to 9:30 pm. With this loan of 1,500 Soles from Manuela Ramos, which will be repaid in 5 moths, Lilian will buy 3 dozen blouses, 3 dozen pieces of underwear, etc. Lilian is very happy, because she says she has a stable client base, which she has won through her effort and perseverance. She feels like her dreams are coming true, and the greatest satisfaction she gets is that her family doesn’t have to suffer the lack of so many things, this makes her feel like a strong person.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

Lilian pertenece al Banco Comunal “Solidaridad” su domicilio esta ubicado en la Urbanización Municipal 6 de Diciembre Mz A Lt 1, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años y es madre de 3 hijos, 1 mayor y dos menores de edad, su esposo es empleado. Lilian quiere ayudar económicamente en casa, es así que solicitó un préstamo a Manuela Ramos por S/. 300.00 soles. En la actualidad cuenta con un pequeño negocio de compra y venta de ropa, donde Lilian viaja una vez por mes hasta la ciudad de Tacna para comprar las prendas. Cada día se levanta a las 6.00 am. Para ir al mercado, dejar todo listo en casa para luego dedicarse a su negocio. Lilian reparte sus pedidos desde las 10:00am hasta la 1:00 pm de ahí se da el tiempo de almorzar y descansar y desde las 5:00pm hasta las 9:30 pm vuelve a su labor. Con este préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 3 docenas de blusas, 3 docenas de ropa interior, etc. Lilian esta muy contenta, porque tiene clientes estables la cual se ha ganado a base de esfuerzo y perseverancia, siente que sus sueños se están realizando y la mejor satisfacción que siente es que su familia ya no tiene que sufrir tantas necesidades y eso la hace sentir fuerte.

loans.use: To purchase clothing at wholesale value.

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias (Women In Solidarity) Group 3

texts.en:
Yameris M. is the single mother of a two-year-old baby girl. She has a small business killing and selling chickens in her community. She has already successfully repaid two loans to Esperanza International and is now applying for her third. With the loan money she will be able to buy more chickens to raise and then sell so that she can better her life.

Yameris has hopes of becoming a better person and she really wants to “ser alguien en la vida,” (to be someone in life). She dreams of being able to provide well for her daughter and of sending her all the way through college so that she can have a professional career. She also dreams of one day owning her very own little house. With your help and her continued loans, Yameris is on her way to making her dreams come true.

Note: This is a group loan for 5 people.

loans.use: to raise, kill and sell more chickens

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Esperanza International, a partner of HOPE International - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Lita Sabel

texts.es:
Lita belongs to the “Las Azucenas II” comunal bank and lives in the Calleria district of the department of Ucayla. She is 38 years old and is a single mother with one son. With the first loan of S/. 300.00 that she received from Manuel Ramos, she decided to invest in a small business selling food. She currently has a restaurant and, with the help of her mother, business is doing well. Lita also works part time in a clinic in administrative services.

With this loan of S/. 1,000.00, which she will repay in 5 months, she will buy supplies for her restaurant: 1 sack of rice, sugar, a gallon of cooking oil, soft drinks, napkins, and bags. Lita has a lot of dedication and energy for her business, which she tends to with great care since her customers are the reason it exists. She hopes to eventually obtain a larger business space and to open an internet café. She wants to continue making progress and also give the best to her parents.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lita pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Azucenas II, ubicado en el Jr. Andres Razuri #186, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 38 años y es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo. Con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertir en un pequeño negocio de venta de comida. En la actualidad tiene un restaurante y con la ayuda de su mamá, su negocio esta surgiendo. Lita también trabaja medio tiempo en una clínica en la parte administrativa. Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, implementará su restaurante, comprará 1 saco de arroz, azúcar, galón de aceite, gaseosas, servilletas y bolsas. Lita tiene una gran energía y dedicación para su negocio, el cual atiende con mucho esmero por que sus clientes son la razón de ser, ella tiene la expectativa de tener un negocio más grande y poner un Internet y seguir progresando y darle de lo mejor a sus padres.

loans.use: To buy ingredients at wholesale price

loans.name: Union Y Amor (Unity & Love) Group 1

texts.en:
Juana is the mother of 4 children, ages 20, 21, 29 and 32. She is also the proud grandmother of 2, ages 6 and 16. Juana has a small business cooking and baking various foods like bread, chicken, and fried foods such as empanadas. She then sells her goods to a traveling salesman who will travel around to various communities on a motorcycle or in a car. This way Juana is able to work from home and be close to her family. She also sews clothing that she then sells in the community. Business can be hard sometimes when there is not enough demand for her products. Having a loan helps her to better weather the dry spells of business and to continue progressing.

Juana has successfully paid back 5 loans to Esperanza International and is now requesting her sixth loan. With the money, she hopes to expand her businesses even more to better proviD. for her family. She wants her children to be able to finish their educations and find good jobs.

Note: This is a group loan for 5 people.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to bake and sell more food products

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Esperanza International, a partner of HOPE International - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Sara Esther

texts.es:
Sara belongs to the “Las Golondrinas 2” comunal bank. She lives in the Callería district of the department of Ucayali. She is 58 years old, she is a teacher by profession, and has been separated from her husband for more than 20 years. She has 5 children, all of whom are independent. With her first loan of S/. 300.00 from Manuela Ramos, Sara decided to invest in buying and selling of lingerie and perfume. The business is located in her home. She also sews clothing people have ordered from her: trousers, bras, polo shirts for women and men, which she takes to the Educational Institution, where the students are the majority of her clients.

With this loan of S/. 1,000.00, which she will pay back in 4 months, she will buy 12 bra sets, 20 meters of cotton fabric, 10 meters of lace, 10 meters of elastic, and 20 meters of fabric for towels. Sara is happy because she feels fulfilled and she also feels young enough to take care of her grandchildren so that her children can use the time to work and continue studying in the educational centers in their town.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Sara pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Golondrinas 2” actualmente vive en el AA. HH. Paican Mz F Lt 20 del Distrito de Callería en el Departamento de Ucayali tiene 58 años. Es docente (profesora) de profesión y está separada de su esposo desde hace mas de 20 años. Tiene 5 hijos, todos independientes. Sara con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.300 decidió invertir en la compra y venta de lencería y perfumería. En la actualidad cuenta con su negocio de lencería y perfumería en su propio domicilio. al mismo tiempo que confecciona los pedidos: trusas, brasier, toallas polos de damas y caballeros para llevarlo a la Institución Educativa y entregar a sus colegas que son la mayoría de sus clientes. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000 soles, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, iInvertirá en la compra 1 docena de conjuntos de brasiers, 20 metros de tela de algodón, 10 metros de blonda 10 metros de elástico, y 20 metros de tela para toallas. Sara se siente feliz por que además que se siente realizada aun se siente joven para atender a sus nietos y así sus hijos puedan aprovechar el tiempo para trabajar y seguir estudiando en los centros superiores de la localidad.

loans.use: To buy lingerie, fabric, and lace at wholesale price

loans.name: Amor Y Paz (Love & Peace) Groups 1&2

texts.en:
Elena is the busy mother of 6 children, ages 22, 24, 26, 28, 29 and 36. She also has two grandchildren, ages 3 and 10. She lives with her husband, daughter, and one grandchild. Elena has a small business making juice, which she then sells in front of her house. With the loan money, she is able to buy more fruit and cups so that she can sell more juice. Business can be hard sometimes when fewer people buy juice. The loan helps her overcome this vulnerability of her small business so that she can continue progressing.

Elena has successfully repaid 5 loans to Esperanza International and is now requesting her 6th loan. She hopes to continue growing her business so that she can better proviD. for her family. She wants all her children to be able to continue studying and to attend the university here. Already two of her children have finished college and she is very proud of them. She would also love to be able to afford her own house one day.

Note: This is a group loan for 10 people.

loans.use: To buy more fruit in order to make and sell more juice

loans.name: Lucinda Aura

texts.es:
Lucinda belongs to the “Mujeres Audaces” comunal bank, and lives in the Yarinacocha district of the department of Ucayali. She is 54 years old and is the mother of 4 children, all of whom are adults. Her husband is an electrician. Lucinda decided to invest in raising chickens and ducks, for which she requested a loan of S/. 300.00 from Manuela Ramos. She has the business in her home. She gets up every day at 5:30am to prepare breakfast and lunch so that her husband can go to work and then she takes care of her animals. In the afternoons from 3:00 to 6:00pm she sells her medicinal products.

With this loan of S/. 1,500.00, which she will repay in 5 months, she will buy 20 hens, 10 roosters, 12 ducks, and 10 jars of medicinal products. Lucinda continues to achieve success in life and she is very happy about the income she is able to generate for her family. She is grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the support they have provided her.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Lucinda pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Audaces” domiciliada en Fonavi Mz 183 Lt S del Distrito D. Yarinacocha en el Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 54 años, es madre D. 4 hijos todos mayores D. edad. Su esposo es electricista. Lucinda decidió invertir en la crianza D. gallinas y patos, para solicitó un préstamo D. S/. 300.00 a Manuela Ramos. En la actualidad este negocio lo maneja en su propio domicilio, para lo cual se levanta todos los días a las 5:30am para preparar el desayuno y el almuerzo para su esposo que sale a trabajar, luego se dedica al cuidado y crianza D. sus animales. Así mismo por las tardes D. 3:00pm a 6:00pm sale a ofrecer y a repartir sus productos medicinales. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,500 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra D. 20 gallinas, 10 gallos, 12 patos y 10 potes variados D. productos medicinales. Lucinda sigue logrando muchos éxitos en su vida y esta muy feliz por los ingresos que pueD. generar para su familia .agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por el respaldo brindado.

loans.use: To buy hens, roosters, and ducks. To buy medicinal products.

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
Zoraida belongs to the comunal bank “Mujeres Audaces”, located in the Yarina Cocha district of the department of Ucayali. She is 47 years old and is the mother of 3 children. Her husband is a teacher. With the first loan of S/. 300.00 that she received from Manuela Ramos, Zoraida invested in lingerie. She sells lingerie and she is also a teacher in Initial Education. In the morning she tends to her garden and in the afternoon she sews lingerie.

With this loan of S/. 1,500.00, which she will pay back in 5 months, she will buy elastic lace and fabrics by the kilo. Zoraida appreciates the support and payment plans offered by Manuela Ramos. She has high hopes to open a lingerie workshop and storage space so that she can continue to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Zoraida pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Audaces, ubicado en el Jr. Dos de Mayo # 544 Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 47 años y es madre de 3 hermosos hijos, su esposo es docente (profesor). Zoraida con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 invirtió en lencería. En la actualidad ella se dedica a la venta de lencería, ella también es docente en Educación Inicial, en las mañanas se va trabajar es su jardín y en las tardes se pone a coser todo lo que es lencería. Con este préstamo de S/.1,500 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará blondas elásticas y telas por kilo. Zoraida agradece el apoyo y las facilidades que le brinda Manuela Ramos, y ella tiene toda la esperanza de hacer su taller de lencería y formar su bodega para que así pueda seguir incrementando su negocio.

loans.use: To buy lace and fabric at wholesale price

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes belongs to the “Las Golondrinas 2” comunal bank and she lives in the Callería district of the department of Ucayali. She is 61 years old, is a widow, and has 9 children, all of whom are adults. Her father, her 37 year-old single son, and 3 grandchildren live with her. The money that her son gives her from his taxi driver job isn’t enough to make ends meet. Therefore, with the firs loan of S/. 300.00 from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in buying and selling fruits and ice creams. She currently runs the business from her home. Lourdes gets up very early in order to make breakfast for her father, son, and grandchildren before going to the market to make her purchases for the day. She then prepares lunch and tends to her business. She finishes her work at 9:00pm.

With this loan of S/. 1,000.00, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy 200 oranges, 200 tangerines, and 200 ice creams. Each day is a challenge for Lourdes. She is very happy for the opportunity provided by Manuela Ramos to obtain a loan and thereby help her grandchildren, who are her greatest treasure.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Lourdes pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Golondrinas 2”domiciliada en el Jr: espinar Nº 371 del Distrito de Callería en el Departamento de Ucayali tiene 61 años. Viuda, con 9 hijos todos mayores. Su papá, su hijo soltero de 37 años y sus 3 nietos menores viven con ella. El apoyo que le brinda su hijo que trabaja como motocarrista no le alcanza, es así que con el primer préstamo de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300 decide invertir en la compra y venta de frutas y chupetes. En la actualidad cuenta con su negocio instalado en su propio domicilio. Lourdes se levanta muy temprano para preparar el desayuno para su padre, hijo y nietos, para luego ir al mercado y realizar sus compras del día. Lourdes se da tiempo para preparar el almuerzo y atender su negocio. Termina su trabajo a las 9:00pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra de 2 cientos de naranja, 2 cientos de mandarina, 1 ciento de tanchello y 2 cientos de chupetes. Cada día, para Lourdes es un reto. Se siente muy feliz por la oportunidad que le brinda Manuela Ramos de recibir un préstamo e invertir y así poder ayudar a sus nietos que son su mayor tesoro.

loans.use: To buy a variety of fruits at wholesale price and ice cream

loans.name: Meri

texts.es:
Meri makes a living selling fruit. She and her husband watch out for the well being of their 6 children and together have been able get all of them ahead and take care of the smaller ones. Her husband works outside of the home but when he is home and has the time he helps Meri in whatever she needs, especially in work that requires physical labor. Meri wishes to get the loan so that she can purchase goods for the improvement of the space where she sells her fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Meri se dedica a la venta de fruta, ella y su esposo velan por el bienestar de sus 6 hijos y juntos han sabido sacar adelante a todos y cuidar de los menores. Su esposo trabaja fuera de casa, pero cuando está y tiene el tiempo para hacerlo apoya en a Meri en lo que necesite, en especial en el trabajo de esfuerzo físico.Meri desea obtener el préstamo que solicita para la compra de mercadería, así como para mejorar el espacio donde conserva la fruta que vende.

loans.use: Funds to invest in her fruit sales business.

loans.name: Kim Quyên's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ngo Kim Quyen (ID Number 03070052), born in 1973, would like to borrow 1,972,000VND to invest in woodcarving and crafting at home. She lives in Ngoc Loi, Duc Tu, Dong Anh, Ha Noi, Vietnam. Her husband is a carpenter while she is a seamstress earning stable daily income. She has 2 school-going children. Her family's average monthly income is 4,000,000VND (about 250USD). As she is responsible and friendly, she is voted as the group leader even though it is only the first time she joined a group to apply for loans. Her group also consists of:

Mrs. Nguyen Thi Thuan (ID Number 03070053), born in 1978, would like to borrow 1,972,000VND to invest in breeding pigs.

Mrs. P. Thi Hanh (ID Number 03070054), born in 1987, would like to borrow 1,972,000VND to invest in her scrap business.

Mrs. Nguyen Thi Tham (ID Number 03070055), born in 1983, would like to borrow 1,972,000VND to invest in woodcarving.

Mrs. Nguyen Thi Tuyet Nhung (ID Number 03070056), born in 1974, would like to borrow 1,972,000VND to invest in breeding chickens.

Mrs. Nguyen Thi Lua (ID Number 03070057), born in 1986, would like to borrow 1,972,000VND to purchase more begetables to sell.

The total amount requested is 725USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Ngô Kim Quyên, sinh năm 1973(Ms 03070052), mức vay: 1.972.000 vnd để đầu tư làm đồ gỗ tại nhà.Gia đình chị hiện đang sống tại Ngọc lôi, Dục tú, Đông Anh, Hà Nội, Việt Nam.Chồng chị là thợ mộc, bản thân chị là thợ may có thu nhập theo ngày, hai con chị còn nhỏ đang độ tuổi đi học.thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 4.000.000 vnđ/tháng. Chị là người có uy tín, cởi mở, thân thiện nên lần đầu tham gia nhóm vay vốn chị đã được các chị em trong nhóm bầu làm nhóm trưởng.Trong nhóm chị còn có: N. Thị Thuần (Ms 03070053), sinh năm 1978, mức vay:1.972.000 vnđ để Chăn nuôi lợn. P. Thị Hạnh (Ms 03070054), sinh năm 1987, mức vay: 1/972.000 vnđ để đi chợ sắt vụn. N. Thị Thắm (Ms 03070055), sinh năm 1983, mức vay: 1.972.000 vnđ để đầu tư mở xưởng gỗ. N. Thị tuyết Nhung (Ms 03070056), sinh năm 1974, mức vay: 1.972.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi gà. N. Thị Lụa (Ms 03070057), sinh năm 1986, mức vay: 1.972.000 vnđ để đi chợ rau.

loans.use: invest in woodcarving

loans.name: Ulugbek

texts.en:
H. Ulugbek is 27 years old. He is married with two children. Ulugbek is a very diligent and hard-working man. He uses his car to provide taxi services inside the city of Istaravshan. For the last four years the current business had been the main income for the family. It allows Ulugbek to improve the living conditions of his large family. In addition to his wife and children, he is also supporting his parents.

As with any business, it requires some investments from time to time. Thus, the car now needs to be fixed. For this purpose Ulugbek requests 600 USD for the term of 6 months. Ulugbek has proved himself to be a reliable client and promises to repay the current loan promptly. He thanks everyone for supporting him.

loans.use: Minor fixes of the vehicle used to provide taxi services.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
H. Halima is 51 years old. She and her husband have raised 5 children. The 2 eldest children are already married and the youngest is still under their care. Halima’s husband is retired on a pension. Halima's business is the main source of income for the family. She has been running her business for 35 years. Halima embroiders national skull-caps for men and women. She is really hard working. Halima gets up very early and goes to bed very late. Halima sells the skull-caps in the local market. Halima, as any Muslim, dreams to make Hadj (she wants to travel to Mecca). Halima wants to expand her business to meet this purpose.

She requests 750 USD for the term of 12 months. Halima plans on purchasing the fabric to embroider the national skull-caps. Halima has been a client of IMON since September 2007. She has shown herself to be a reliable client. Your support will really help her. Let’s get behind this dedicated mother to make her dream become a reality.

loans.use: Purchase fabric to embroider the national skull-caps.

loans.name: Thi Khiem's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Khiem (ID Number 03070006), born in 1974, would like to borrow 3,604,000VND to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell. She has 2 school-going children. Everyday she sells fruits and vegetables in the market whiL. her husband works as a carpenter, earning stabL. income. Her family's average daily income is 150,000VND (about 9.50USD) so it is quite easy for her to repay the loan on an installment basis. Seeing the advantages of borrowing to increase income, she and other villagers have decided to apply for loans so that they can improve their families' economy and skills. Her group also consists of:

Mrs. L. Thi Thuoc (ID Number 03070009), born in 1964, would like to borrow 3,604,000VND to purchase a buffalo and invest in breeding ducks.

Mrs. H. Thi Chien (ID Number 03070010), born in 1965, would like to borrow 3,604,000VND to invest in her cafe.

Mrs.N. Thi Hoai (ID Number 03070046), born in 1985, would like to borrow 2,756,000VND to open a woodcarving shop.

Mrs. L. Thi Xuyen (ID Number 03070007), born in 1966, would like to borrow 3,604,000VND to invest in crafting.

Mrs. H. Thi Thao (ID Number 03070008), born in 1984, would like to borrow 3,604,000VND to invest in her souvenir shop.

Mrs. L. Kim Oanh (ID Number 03070011), born in 1959, would like to borrow 3,604,000VND to invest in her butcher shop.

The total amount requested is 1450USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Khiêm, sinh năm 1974(Ms 03070006), mức vay:3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư bán hàng hoa quả.Vợ chồng chị có hai con nhỏ đang trong độ tuổi đi học.Hàng ngày chị đi chợ bán hoa quả, chồng chị là thợ mộc có thu nhập ổn định. Thu nhập bình quân mỗi ngày của vợ chồng chị khoảng 150.000 vnđ nên rất dễ dàng với những khoản vốn vay trả góp.Thấy được lợi ích của vay vốn phát triển kinh tế, chị và những người trong làng mạnh dạn đăng ký tham gia vay vốn với mục tiêu cải thiện mức sống, kỹ năng sống.Trong nhóm chị còn có:

  • Lê Thị Thước (Ms 03070009), sinh năm 1964, mức vay:3.604.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi vịt và mua một con trâu
  • Hoàng Thị Chiến (Ms 03070010), sinh năm 1965, mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư cửa hàng giải khát.
  • Nguyễn Thị Hoài (Ms 03070046), sinh năm 1985, mức vay: 2.756.000 vnđ để đầu tư mở xưởng gỗ.
  • Lê Thị Xuyến (Ms 03070007), sinh năm 1966, mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư làm đồ thủ công mỹ nghệ.
