She successfully manages a little shop where she sells a variety of non-perishable grocery items such as drinks, household chemicals, clothing and footwear items. Tatyana has been involved in this type of business for more than 3 years. Through her perseverance and hard work she has been able to reinvest profits into her business and see it develop. Today her total net income amounts to $500 a month and she has about $3000 invested in inventory.

Tatyana's enthusiasm and the relationships she has built with her customers show that she is doing what she does best --cheerfully serving others. She has created a loyal base of customers who always try to stop by and purchase from her shop. She is a warm and communicative woman, who looks forward to what the future holds. Her desire is to be a help to her husband as they both strive to support and raise their children. Tatyana is requesting a loan of 4560 Grivnas to purchase variety of grocery items in bulk. She believes that this will eliminate the need for her to buy products as often and therefore save her some money on transportation and unloading.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina lives in Nikopol and runs her business located in the Central Market. She became an entrepreneur only six months ago. She was in need of money and bravely started her small venture selling cosmetics and body care items. Valentina presently makes about $200 in profit each month.

Valentina is planning to use the loan of 3000 Grivnas ($US675) to increase her seasonal stock. She is always ready to work inventively to realize her personal and financial goals. We believe the client has the determination to make her business expand following the route of success and providing a supplemental income to her household.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr:
Born in 1977, Mrs. Ami K. is a farm worker who loves growing corn. The mother of two children, she is able to contribute toward the household expenses thanks to her earnings. She is very attached to growing corn, which is of major importance to their everyday diet and is a source of income for them. A real go-getter, she manages her business activities very well, and is requesting financing to enable her to increase the area she cultivates and therefore her income. In this way she will have sufficient means to make a greater contribution toward improving the family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1977, Madame K. Ami est une cultivatrice qui aime la culture du maïs. Mère de deux (2) enfants, elle arrive à contribuer aux charges du ménage grâce à ses revenus. Elle est très attachée à la culture du maïs qui a une importance capitale dans leur habitude alimentaire et est source de revenu dans le milieu. Très battante, elle gère bien ses activités et sollicite un financement qui va lui permettre d’augmenter sa superficie cultivée et de facto augmenter ses revenus. Ainsi, elle pourra avoir les moyens suffisants pour plus contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: To increase the size of her cultivable land

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is married with two teenage kids. She runs a small business selling children's clothing in the local market of Vasilyevka. She is a skillful manager who knows how to survive in a competitive market economy environment. Victoria has been in this business for over 10 years. Currently, she has about $3000 in inventory. 

Victoria's consistency, perseverance and commitment to her business have ensured the growth and success of her small venture. She always treats people with respect, which is one of the most effective methods of providing her business with a solid foundation. She also has a unique ability to reach and maintain the right customers. Moreover, Victoria is always willing to help her clients with tips, which oftentimes are much needed.

At the moment she is requesting a loan of 1000 Grivnas ($US350) to increase the inventory for sale in her kiosk. 

Note: This is a short term "express" loan that will be repaid in a month.

loans.use: To grow her trade

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramón began his business to improve and offer a better quality of life for his family. He wasn’t able to find good work that would give him the opportunity to improve and be able to have better income for his family, so he decided to begin his own business in 2002, selling tools and scrap metal. He began with little merchandise, and upon seeing that he could earn an income he continued working hard to make his business successful.

He needs a loan for US$250, which will be repaid in 3 months, to buy merchandise and be able to continue with his business. With your support Ramón will be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Ramon inicio el negocio para tratar de mejorar y poder darle mejor calidad de vida a su familia. En ese momento no encontraba un buen trabajo que le diera la oportunidad de mejorar y poder tener mejores ingresos para su familia, por lo que decidio emprender su propio negocio, comenzo en el año 2002 con la venta de herramienta y chatarra, con muy poca mercancia, al ver que si le podia redituar siguio esforzandose para sacar adelante su negocio.

El necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancia y poder seguir con su negocio. Con tu apoyo Ramon saldra adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married and has grown children who live in a different country. He lives in Vasilyevka, Ukraine. Alexander runs a small business selling general goods in the local market. His kiosk is located on the main market aisle where there are many customers every day. Alexander has been in business for over seven years. His wife actively helps him with operations. Currently, his monthly gross income is about $2,000.

Alexander is a high achiever and a consistent entrepreneur who is very knowledgeable about the market environment. His professional skills and perseverance have helped to ensure rapid growth and success of his business.

Alexander is requesting a loan for 3000 Grivnas ($US675) to increase the assortment of inventory in his kiosk. He is hoping that this loan will help his venture grow and generate extra profits. We believe that Alexander's ability to identify tasks critical to business success and set up a system for accomplishing them will allow him to continue growing in the sphere of private entrepreneurship. 

Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Confort

texts.fr:
Mrs. Confort G. was born in 1977. Having abandoned school at a very young age, she has devoted herself to farming. Specializing in growing cassava, she has mastered this art very well, and it provides her with the minimum amount of income required to meet the needs of her five children. She is requesting financing in order to increase the size of her cassava field so that she can boost her income and make a greater contribution towards improving the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame G. Confort est née en1977. Abandonna très tôt ses études, elle s’est donnée à l’agriculture. La culture du manioc étant sa spécialité, elle maîtrise très bien ce domaine qui lui procure le revenu minimum pour subvenir aux besoins de ses cinq (5) enfants. Elle sollicite un financement qui lui servira à agrandir son champ de manioc afin d’augmenter ses revenus pour mieux contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To increase the size of her cassava field

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is married with two grown children. She owns a small kiosk selling socks and underwear in downtown Nyzhniv, Ivano-Frankivsk region. Close proximity to a busy central market makes it a very favorable location for business growth. Mariya offers low prices and good quality of inventory. Currently, she earns about $700 monthly income from her business. 

Mariya has been working in this business for two years. She used to work as a secretary in Nyzhniv town administration office but she faced some problems with her health and had to quit her job. This is how she took a risk and launched her own venture selling clothing.

Hard-work and tenacity have helped her enterprise reach sustainability and success. Mariya would like to get a loan for 3000 Grivnas ($US675) to purchase 50 sets of underwear and socks. The extra supply of inventory will help her generate additional income. Mariya is hoping that increased sales activity will generate the necessary funds to sustain her business as well as to meet her family's needs.    

Note: This is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To purchase 50 sets of underwear and socks.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with two daughters. She owns a small business and works in the central city market of Pavlograd, in the so-called Trade Gallery. Irina sells women's teenage clothing items. All her merchandise is very high quality and can meet varying customers' demands. Irina started her business 11 years ago. Currently, she has about $9000 invested in inventory. Her monthly income is about $1000. 

Irina has proved to be a very reliable client. Her venture has been growing consistently into a stable and sustainable business. Irina likes to move on and not just be satisfied with present successes. She is hoping additional funding will help her re-stock her inventory and construct a new vending kiosk in the same market. She is requesting a 3000 Grivna ($US675) loan to implement these goals.  

Note: This is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for clothing sales.

loans.name: Socorro Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia began her business to earn a living and provide a better quality of life for her children. She decided to begin the business as her husband’s income didn’t cover their household expenses. Over a year ago she began selling telephone equipment to her neighbors and acquaintances, little by little growing her customer base and they recommended her to others and now she earns a good income.

She needs a loan of US $500, which will be repaid in 6 months, to buy more equipment. With your help Patricia will be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Patricia inicio el negocio para prosperar y darle mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Ella decidio iniciar su negocio ya que con el sueldo de su esposo no les alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos familiares. Comenzo hace mas de uño vendiendo equipos telefonicos con sus vecinas y familiares, poco a poco logro hacer cartera de clientes y ellos la recomendaron con mas gente hasta lograr mejorar sus ingresos.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para poder comprar mas equipos, con tu apoyo Patricia saldra adelante.

loans.use: Purchase telephone systems to resell

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #57382

loans.name: Samuel Trust Group

texts.en: Esther S. is a divorced wife with five children. She is a 54-year-old trader of used bed spreads. She is the leader of a seven-member group with six females and a single male. These are the breadwinners of their families. They all have children who are currently in school. They are engaged in the trading of food stuffs, clothing, cosmetics, groceries, etc. as the source of livelihood for their homes. However, they barely make enough income to meet the demands of their households due to inadequate working capital. Their common dream is to see their businesses grow one day to enable them to improve the living conditions of their families. They believe this loan will help them to inject more capital into their businesses to materialize this dream. They belong to the group called Samuel Trust Group. Members in this group agree to guarantee for one another as a social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase increased stock of food stuffs, groceries, clothes, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
Mr. M. is asking for a second loan from Kiva. His first loan was used to buy merchandise for his grocery store. He has repaid his first loan.

His business doesn’t have a permanent roof, the current roof is plastic. He wants to buy materials to put a wood roof on his store and be able to protect his merchandise.

He is asking for a loan of $500 dollars.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. M. esta pidiendo su segundo crédito con Kiva. Su primero crédito se utilizó para comprar mercancía para su tienda de abarrotes. El ya termino de pagar su primer crédito.

El negocio no cuenta con un techo fijo el que tiene es de plástico. En este nuevo crédito el quiere comprar el material para poner el techo de madera en el negocio y tener más protegida la mercancía.

El solicita un préstamo de $500.00 dolares.

loans.use: Buy materials for a wood roof.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Born in 1980 in Gavikopé (in Zio Prefecture), Mrs. Adjo K. had to abandon her studies at primary level due to lack of means. A widow and the mother of four children, she has devoted herself to growing corn, which enables her to provide for her children's needs since her husband left no inheritance. She is requesting financing so that she can increase the area of land she cultivates and, consequently, her income. This will allow her to provide adequately for the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1980 à Gavikopé (P/Zio), Madame K. Adjo a abandonné ses études primaires pour faute de moyens. Veuve et mère de quatre (4) enfants, elle s’est donnée à la culture du maïs qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants car son mari n’a rien laissé comme héritage. Elle sollicite un financement qui lui permettra d’augmenter sa surface cultivée et de facto ses besoins. Ce qui lui permettra alors de subvenir convenablement aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To increase the size of her corn field

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en: Godwin is 33 years old. He is married with two kids who are currently in school. Godwin is a dealer in electrical and electronic parts like speakers, transistors, transformers, screw drivers, wires, television cords, antennas, etc. He also provides repairs and servicing works for his customers. He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices and sells to his customers at retail prices. He requests the loan to enable him procure increased stock of electrical and electronic parts. He hopes to increase his savings to expand his shop to include refrigerators and parts. He belongs to the community group called Evergreen Trust Group. In this group, members agree to guarantee for each other as a social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To procure increased stock of electrical and electronic parts.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr:
Born in 1979, Mrs. Akou G. is married and the mother of four children. She has launched herself into farming and, in particular, growing corn, which earns her just enough to support her family. She is very attached to working on the land and has great faith in it. She is requesting financing in order to increase her cultivable land. This will help her satisfy her customers and provide for her family’s needs.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1979, Madame G. Akou est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Elle s’est lancée dans les travaux champêtres spécialement la culture de maïs. Ce qui lui assure le minimum vital de la famille. Très liée à ce métier de la terre, elle ne se décourage pas. Elle sollicite un financement pour augmenter sa surface cultivable. Ce qui l’aidera à satisfaire sa clientèle et à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To increase her cultivable land

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Born in 1977 and the father of two children, Mr. Kodjo A. left school early to devote himself to farming, which earns him just enough to support his family. He is still very attached to this profession. Honest and full of energy, he is requesting financing so that he can increase the area he cultivates and, consequently, his income. This will enable him to provide for his family’s needs.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1977 et père de deux (2) enfants, Monsieur A. Kodjo a vite quitté les bancs pour s’adonner aux activités champêtres qui lui assurent le minimum vital pour sa famille. Il reste très attaché à ce métier. Très dynamique et honnête, il sollicite un financement afin de pouvoir augmenter sa superficie cultivée et de facto ses revenus. Ainsi il pourra subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To increase his cultivable land

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Born in 1986, Mrs. Abra T. had to leave school at primary level due to lack of means. She devoted herself to working in the fields, in particular to growing corn, which enabled her to make ends meet. She is married and has two children to look after. She is a hard worker and is requesting financing to enable her to increase the area of land she cultivates, and consequently her income, in order to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1986, Madame T. Abra a abandonné ses études primaires faute de moyens. Elle s’est adonnée aux activités champêtres spécialement la culture du maïs qui lui permet de joindre les deux bouts. Mariée, elle a deux (2) enfants à sa charge. Elle ne recule pas devant ses activités et sollicite un financement qui va lui permettre d’agrandir sa superficie cultivée et de facto ses revenus pour l’améliorations des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To increase her cultivable land

loans.name: Yeredon (Knowing Yourself) Group

texts.fr:
The members of the Yeredon group are married women with an average of 25 years of age and 4 children. They live in traditional families with their husbands, in-laws and children in the village of Sikouna 1 in the Fana area (Koulikoro region in Mali). They buy and sell food condiments, charcoal and various other items. The women of the Yeredon group are related or have built strong friendships. This is their first group loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. The sources of their supplies vary according to the items they sell; for charcoal, it is primarily sold on the spot in the surrounding villages through farmers officially appointed to trade it in the area. The main point of their cash sales is in Sikouna 1 and at the market on market days. Their customers are made up of wholesalers from the cities, women and some men. With this loan, they would like to grow their monthly income with which they will pay the interest on the loan and invest the remainder in their respective activities. Their long-term goal is to become wholesalers. Please note that due to health reasons one group member is missing from the photograph.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Les membres du groupe Yeredon sont mariés avec une moyenne d’age de 25 ans et 4enfants .Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, les beaux parents et les enfants dans le village de Sikouna 1 sous préfecture de Fana (Région de Koulikoro République du Mali). Elles font généralement le commerce de condiments alimentaires de charbon de bois et d’articles divers. Les femmes du groupe Yeredon ont une relation de voisinage d’alliances et d’amitié. Elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire de groupe avec Soro Yiriwaso. Les sources d’approvisionnement sont diverses et variées suivant les articles : pour le charbon de bois c’est essentiellement sur place et dans les villages environnants avec les paysans officiellement mandatés pour l’exercice de cette activité. Elles effectuent leurs ventes sur place à Sikouna 1 en gros au comptant en détail et au marché surtout les jours de foire. Leur clientèle est composée de forains grossistes venant des villes, de femmes et de quelques hommes. Avec ce prêt les membres du groupe Yeredon comptent réaliser des bénéfices moyens mensuels qu’elles utiliseront à payer les intérêts du prêt et investir le reste dans leurs activités respectives Elles envisagent devenir des grossistes. C’est pour des raisons de santé qu’une cliente manque à la photo de groupe.

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal and various items

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas has been working in this field for more than 20 years, and has owned his own business for 3 years. His electronic repair shop is located in his home. His business is the only source of income to support his family, which lives in another state.

He is asking for his first loan from Kiva to buy diagnostic equipment (for example, a voltage test meter) and electronic parts needed to make repairs on televisions, dvd players, speakers, and other electronic devices.

He is asking for a $700 dollar loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Tomas tiene más de 20 años en este oficio, tiene 3 años de tener su propio negocio. El vive en una casa donde tiene su taller de reparaciones de aparatos electrónicos. Su negocio es la única fuente de ingresos que cuenta el para sostener a su familia que vive en otro estado.

El está pidiendo su primer préstamo de Kiva para la compra de equipo de diagnóstico (Por ejemplo, tester de voltaje digital) y piezas de electrónica que son necesarias para hacer reparación de televisores, dvd, sonidos y otros aparatos de electrónica.

El está pidiendo un préstamo de $700 dólares.

loans.use: Purchase electronic diagnostic equipment

loans.name: Kossi  Somé

texts.fr:
Born in 1960, Mr. Kossi Somé K. is married and the father of seven (7) children. His main occupation is agriculture. He cultivates grains and okra. A very dedicated man, he is requesting a loan to increase his cultivable area by purchasing fertilizer and insecticides. This will increase his yield and thus increase his income.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1960, Monsieur K. Kossi Somé a laissé est marié et père de sept (7) enfants. Son activité principale est l’agriculture. Il fait la culture céréalière et du gombo. Très dévoué, il sollicite un financement pour augmenter sa superficie cultivable en achetant de l’engrais et des insecticides. Ceci augmentera son rendement ainsi que ses revenus.

loans.use: The purchase of fertilizer and insecticides to increase his cultivable area.

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr:
Babacar opened a tailor's workshop that he manages with his apprentices. To grow his income, he wants to buy some cloth, thread, and trim in large amounts. To finance his business, he was a recipient of a loan of 250,000 francs CFA from IMCEC. With this purchase of goods, thanks to the loan, he will benefit from economies of scale and thus grow his income for fortifying or refurbishing his machines.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Babacar a ouvert un atelier de tailleur qu'il gére avec ses apprentits.Pour accroitre ses revenus ,il veut acheter des tissus ,du fils et de la garniture en quantité . Pour financer son activité,il a bénéficié d'un pret de 250000f cfa de l'IMCEC.Avec l'achat de ces produits grace au pret, il bénéficiera des économies d'échelles et ainsi accroitre ses revenus pour renforcer ou renouveler ses machines.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Yiriwa (Progress). Group

texts.fr:
Members of the Yiriwa group are married women with an average of 20 years of age and 4 children. They live with their husbands and children in polygamous families in Sikouna 2, a village in the Fana area of Koulikoro in Mali. The Yiriwa group is involved in the breeding and the sale of livestock products (sale of live animals, butter, fresh milk, yogurt, curdled milk, etc). This group of Peulh women (a semi-nomadic people of West Africa specialized in the breeding of cattle), bound through ethnic and linguistic but also family ties, decided to borrow together from the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. This is their first group loan. With this loan, they would like to build their supplies of cattle food and medication at the veterinary pharmacies in Fana, Marka coungo and Santiguila. They usually sell the livestock and products for cash on market days in these cities, and their business runs year round. In addition to the breeding, some of them sell various articles such as flour. Each member of the group hopes to have a monthly profit of 7.500FCFA which will be used to build their capital.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Les membres du groupe Yiriwa sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’age de 20 ans et 4 enfants .Elles vivent avec leurs maris et enfants dans de familles polygames à Sikouna 2 un village de Fana Région de Koulikoro République du Mali. Le groupe Yiriwa fait de l’élevage et la vente des sous produits de l’élevage (La vente d’animaux sur pied, le beurre de vache, le lait frais, le Yaourt et le lait caillé etc.). Ce groupe de femmes Peulh (une ethnie semi nomade de l’Afrique de l’Ouest spécialisée dans l’élevage de bétail) lié par des relations non seulement ethnique et linguistique mais aussi des liens de parenté et d’alliance a décidé d’emprunter ensemble à l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Avec ce prêt elles comptent se ravitailler en médicaments et aliments pour bétail dans les pharmacies vétérinaires à Fana, Marka coungo et Santiguila. Elles effectuent leurs ventes (Animaux sur pied et sous produits de l’élevage) généralement les jours de foire de ses mêmes localités au comptant.. Cette activé est menée durant toute l’année. En plus de l’élevage certaines d’entre elles font le petit commerce de divers articles : arachide farine de niébé produits de cueillette. Chaque membre du groupe espère avoir un bénéfice de 7.500FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé à renforcer le capital.

loans.use: Purchase of cattle medication and food

loans.name: Trabajando Unidos Group

texts.es:
Hi!  We're the Trabajando Unidos ("Working Together") group.  We're all merchants, each with our own small business.  We have various years of experience operating our businesses.  We know each other well, having long worked together.  Thanks to the incomes from our different businesses, we can support our families.  We should mention, too, how grateful we are to all of you for the support that you extend to us so that we can push our businesses forward.

These are the businesses that we've created:

Rosa Idalia Del Carmen E..  I'm a merchant.  I have a general store in the center of my town.  I'm a single mother and I have a high school-aged son who helps me with the business in his spare time.  I'm asking for your help so that I can stock my business and meet the demand of my customers.

Carlos Alberto C..  My main work is reselling merchandise but I'm also the pastor of a church in my town.  I work as a street vendor, selling milk products.  I have 5 elementary school-aged children.

Jose Daniel C..  My main work is selling and repairing bicycles.  I've made a living this way for some years and, thanks to God, it generates enough income to cover the needs of my family.  I'm married and have 4 children, all of whom are school-aged.  They help me with the business and together we're pushing it forward.
Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer
Hola nosotros somo sle grupo Trabajando Unidos, todos somos comerciantes cada uno tenemos pequeños negocios, los  que son administrados por nosotros,  tenemos varios años de experincia en nuestras actividades que hacemos, nos conocemos bien siempre hemos trabajado juntos, gracias a los ingresos que percibimos de nuestros diferentes negocios podemos cubrir los gastos de nuestras familias . Es importante mencionar que gracias al apoyo que ustedes nos brinden, podemos salir adelante con nuestros negocios.

estas son las actividades que realizamos:

Rosa Idalia Del Carmen E. soy comerciante tengo una puperia hubicada en el centro de mi  comunidad soy madre soltera y tengo un hijo el que esta cursando la secundaria  el que me colabora su tiempo libre razon por la cual solicito el apoyo de ustedes para poder abastecer mas mi negocio y poder cubrir con las exigencias de todos mis clientes.

Carlos Alberto C. mi actividad principal es el comercio y  tambien pastoreo la iguesia de mi comunidad cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de productos lacteos los que  distrbuyo de forma ambulante tengo 5 hijos los que estan cursando educacion primaria. 

Jose Daniel C.   Mi actividad principal es la venta y reparacion de Bicicletas, tengo  varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que gracias a Dios me genera ingresos para cubrir con los gastos de mi familia, estoy casado y tenemos 4 hijos,  actualmente mis hijos estan en edad escolar,  ellos me colaboran y asi juntos sacamos adelante el negocio.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Born in 1966, Mrs. Adjo K. left her studies very early. Not having been encouraged ahead in her studies, she turned to working the earth and like her husband she is particularly involved with the cultivation of cassava. A mother of eight (8) children, she manages to provide for the needs of her family. She is requesting a loan to increase her cultivable land. This will allow her to increase her income. She will therefore be able to secure a suitable life for her family.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1966, Madame K. Adjo a quitté très tôt le banc des classes. N’ayant pas été bien poussé dans les études, elle se livre au travail de la terre notamment la culture du manioc de même que son mari. Mère de huit (8) enfants, elle arrive à subvenir au besoin de sa famille. Elle sollicite un financement pour agrandir sa surface cultivable. Ceci lui permettre d’accroître ses revenus. Il pourra alors assurer convenablement la vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Increase her cultivable land

loans.name: Kadiatou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Kadiatou S. is a 49 year-old mother of 6 children. She lives in a close-knit family with her husband and her children in Fana Coura, one of the districts of the Fana region (Koulikoro area in Mali). For social reasons, she had to give up her studies to help her mother with housework and in the kitchen. After more than 15 years of working with and learning from her mother, she decided to open a restaurant. Her restaurant is located at the large Fana market on a very busy crossroad. Her clientele are mainly travellers, drivers and people going to the market. The variety of meals in her restaurant is very appreciated by the regulars. In order to obtain additional resources to support her restaurand amidst increasing competition, she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance instutution. After 3 group loans through a local association, this is her fourth individual loan. All of her previous loans were refunded in time. With this loan, she would like to buy 600 kg of rice and a large quantity of condiments to build her supplies. Currently she earns approximately 35.000 FCFA, but with this new loan, hopes to increase it to 45.000 CFA, which she will use to help her husband with the family expenses and to invest the remainder in her business and in buying equipment for the restaurant.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Kadiatou S. est âgée de 49 ans, .mère de 6 enfants et vit dans une famille nucléaire avec son époux et ses enfants à Fana Coura un des quartiers de la sous préfecture de Fana (Région de Koulikoro République du Mali). Pour des raisons sociales, elle abandonna les études pour aider sa mère dans les travaux domestiques notamment la cuisine et les activités économiques. Après plus de 15 ans aux services de sa mère, elle décida de s’installer et de faire de la restauration qu’elle a apprise auprès de sa mère. Son restaurant est situé au grand marché de Fana sur un axe routier très fréquenté. Sa clientèle est constituée de passagers, de chauffeurs et des individus fréquentant le marché. Ses repas copieux divers et variés sont très appréciés des habitués de cette localité. Afin d’obtenir des ressources complémentaires pour supporter la concurrence de plus en plus rude, elle décida d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Après 3 prêts de groupe avec une association de son quartier, elle est à son quatrième individuel et tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt : 600 kg de riz et une importante quantité de condiments pour constituer un stock. Actuellement elle réalise un bénéfice de 35.000 FCFA mais espère avec ce nouveau prêt avoir un bénéfice de 45.000 CFA qu’elle utilisera pour aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales et investir le reste dans son activité surtout dans les équipements de restauration.

loans.use: Purchase of large quantity of rice

loans.name: Los Robles Group

texts.es:
Hi.  We're the Los Robles ("The Oaks") group.  We're merchants, each with his or her own small business which we operate personally.  Thanks to these businesses, we can help our families get ahead and provide higher standards of living for our children.  Given the economic situation of our country, which is becoming more difficult by the day, we have to make our own work and that's why we're looking for help to fund our businesses.  We now need small supplies of goods for our businesses so that we can offer our customers a range of products and, in turn, increase our incomes.  After all, more inventory means more sales.

MIGUEL AGEL D..  My main business is buying and selling produce.  I work as a street vendor, selling my products in the various neighborhoods of our city.  I have several years' experience at this.  I am married and I have 3 children who help me in their spare time.

HUMBERTO R..  I operate a small general store in the center of my neighborhood.  I have several years' experience at this and I've built a good customer base.  I'm a senior citizen.  I'm asking you to help me fund stocks of goods for my business.

VENTURA DE JESUS M..  I operate a small general store at my house.  The business allows me to take care of my husband and children and earn an income to help with family expenses at the same time.  I have two high school-aged children.
Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer
hola nosotros somos el grupo Los Robles, todos somos comerciantes cada uno cuenta con pequeños negocios, los que son administrados personalmente, gracias a estos negocios podemos sacar adelante a nuestras familias y asi poder ofrecer a nuestros hijos un mejor nivel de vida. Tomando en cuenta  que la situacion economica del pais cada dia es mas dificil por lo que decidimos trabajar y por tal razon buscamos financiamiento para nuestros negocios.  Actualmente necesitamos surtir un poco mas y asi poder ofrecer a nuestros clientes variedad de productos logrando asi mejorar nuestros ingresos ya que a mayor surtido mayor venta.

MIGUEL AGEL D..  Mi actividad principal  la compra y venta de verduras, las que distribuyo
de  manera ambulante en las diferentes comunidades aledañas a nuestra ciudad. Tengo varios años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad,  soy casado y tengo 3 hijos los que me colaboran en su tiempo libre.

HUMBERTO R. soy comerciante cuento con una pequeña pulperia hubicada en el centro 
de mi comunidad tengo varios años de experiencia y tengo muy buena clientela soy de la tercera edad y en esta oportunidad estamos solicitando nos apoyen con capital para poder surtir mas mi negocio

VENTURA DE JESUS M. mi actividad principal es el comercio cuento con una pulperia en mi casa de habitacion, la que me permite atender esposo e hijos y a la vez puedo generar ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia tengo dos hijos los que estan cursando educacion secundaria.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Alfa Y Omega Group

texts.es:
Hi.  We are the Alfa y Omega ("Alpha & Omega") group.  We earn our living buying and selling merchandise, each one of us operating small businesses, selling different kinds of products.  We've known each other for some years and we've always worked together.  Thanks to the income from our businesses, we've been able to improve the lives of our children and have higher standards of living.

Antonia V..  My main business is making and selling tortillas.  I'm a senior citizen now.  Thanks to the income from this business, I can help my husband with family expenses.  We support each other and that's how we managed to build our house.

Norma Suypa G..  My main business is making and selling clothes and "chicharras" (not sure, literally cicadias, so possibly something that makes a sound or looks like a cicadia?).  I have a daughter who is in the first grade.  I should mention that thanks to this business, I can contribute to paying my family's expenses.  We've managed to buy a solar panel to use at the house that we'll build later.

Luis Edgardo L. M..  I work as a street vendor, selling new clothing in different neighborhood around the city of Danli.  My wife and I are trying to improve our standard of living.  We have a boy at a local preschool.  We now need to stock our business but we don't have enough capital to do it so we're applying to you for help.
Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer
hola nosotros somos el grupo alfa y omega, nuestra actividad principal es el comercio, cada uno de nosotros cuenta con un pequeño nengocio de diferentes actividades, tenemos varios años de conocernos y siempre hemos trabajado juntos,  gracias a los ingresos que nos generas estos negocios hemos podido sacar adelante a nuestros hijos y asi lograr un merjor nivel de vida.

Antonia V..  Mi actividad principal es la elaboracion y venta de tortillas, soy de la tercera edad, gracias a los ingresos que tengo de este negocio puedo ayudar a mi esposo con los  gastos familiares,  ya que nos apoyamos mutuamente y asi es como hemos logrado construir nuestra Casa.

Norma Suypa G.. Mi actividad principal es la confeccion de ropa y elaboracion y venta de 
chicharras, tengo una hija la que esta en 1er grado, es importante mencionar que gracias a 
este negocio puedo contribuir con los gastos de mi familia logrando asi comprar un solar
para posteriormente construir nuestra casa.

Luis Edgardo L. M. tengo un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa nueva, el que distribuyo de manera ambulantes en los diferentes barrios y Colonias de esta ciudad de Danli.  atentemos mi esposa y yo hemos mejorado nuestro nivel de vidad, tenemos un niño el que esta cursando educacion Prebasica, actualmente necesitamos surtir nuestro negocio y no contamos con el capital suficiente, razon por la cual solicitamos el apoyo de ustedes.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Born in 1959, Mrs. Abra A. is a married mother of three (3) children. Very early she became involved in the preparation and sale of palm oil and thanks to this income she is able to contribute to the needs of her household. To better satisfy her clientele and to grow her production, she is requesting a loan to purchase large quantities of palm nuts. This will help her to better support her needs.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Abra est née en 1959, mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Très tôt, elles s’est lancée dans la préparation et la vente de l’huile de palme et grâce à ses revenus elle arrive à contribuer au besoin du foyer. Pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et accroître sa production, elle sollicite un financement pour acheter en grande quantité les noix de palme. Ceci l’aidera à mieux subvenir à ses besoins.

loans.use: The purchase of large quantities of palm nuts

loans.name: Angelo

texts.fr:
Aged 35, Mr. Angelo A. was born in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. He is married and a father of 3: Gloria, 13, Crespin 9, and Judicael, 6, who are all in school. He has been a dressmaker for 15 years. Outside of fulfilling his clients’ orders, he makes designs for his specialized clients to resell. He is seeking his second loan at Alidé to increase his capital in order to reach a higher share of the market.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Agé de 35 ans monsieur A. Angelo est né à Cotonou la capitale économique du BENIN. Marié et père de 03 enfants: Gloria 13 ans en classe de 5ème, Crespin 09 ans en classe de CE2 et Judicael 06 ans en classe de CP. Couturier de profession, il exerce ce métier depuis 15 ans. En dehors de la commande de ses clients, il confectionne des modèles qu'il livre à des clients spécialisés dans la revente. Il sollicite son deuxième crédit à Alidé pour accroître son capital afin de gagner une part de marché plus élevée.

loans.use: To purchase 4 rolls of thread, 2 rolls of poplin and 8 pieces of fabric

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Born in 1978, Mrs. Akossiwa E. abandoned her studies very early and gave herself over to field work with her husband. Married and the mother of three (3) children, she became attached to this work which provides income to help her support the very basic needs of her family. A very energetic and honest woman, she is requesting a loan to expand her farmable land and thus increase her income. By doing so, she will be able to provide for her family in a more satisfactory manner.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1978, Madame E. Akossiwa abandonne très tôt ses études et s’est livrée aux travaux champêtres avec son mari. Mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants s’est attachée à ces activités qui lui procurent de revenus qui l’aident à subvenir au minimum vital de sa famille. Très dynamique et honnête, elle sollicite un financement pour accroître sa surface cultivable de facto ses revenus. De ce fait elle pourra subvenir de façon satisfaisante à sa famille.

loans.use: To expand her farmable land

loans.name: Roukayatou

texts.fr:
Born April 6, 1963, in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Mrs. Roukayatou A. is married and a mother of 6: the eldest, Djèlilatou, is 25, and the youngest, Raîmatou, is 7 and in school. A building painter by profession, she has also been selling different items from a young age. She is seeking this loan to increase the level of her business and to satisfy the constantly growing demand of her clientele.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 06 Avril 1963 à Cotonou capitale économique du BENIN, dame A. Roukayatou est mariée et mère de 06 enfants dont l'aîné Djèlilatou a 25ans et le benjamin Raîmatou 07 ans est en classe de CP. Peintre-bâtiment de profession,elle s'est mise dans la vente de divers articles depuis son jeune âge. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour accroître le niveau de son activité et pour satisfaire à la demande sans cesse croissante de sa clientèle.

loans.use: To purchase two boxes of different canned goods and toiletries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her cultivation area

loans.name: Aminatou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Aminatou A.  was born April 10, 1964, in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to a car fleet manager and is a mother of 3: Zoulkif, 22, Bilann, 15, and Fadil, 13, who are all in school. She has been a hairdresser for 15 years. She also sells beauty products as well as fruit juices. She is seeking this loan to build up her business and to satisfy the demand of her current and future clients seeking her services. 
 Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.
Dame A. Aminatou est née  le 10 Avril 1964 à Cotonou, capitale économique du BENIN.Elle est mariée à un chef parc automobile et est  mère de 03 enfants: zoulkif 22 ans en classe de Terminale au cours secondaire, Bilann 15 ans en classe de Troisième au cours secondaire et Fadil 13 ans en classe de quatrième au cours secondaire. Coiffeuse de profession, elle exerce ce métier depuis 15 ans. Parallèlement à celle ci  elle vend des produits cosmétiques ainsi que des jus de fruits. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son activité et  aussi pour satisfaire à la demande de sa clientèle et des futurs clients qui aimeront solliciter ses services.

loans.use: To purchase 5 bags of hair extensions and a box of beauty products

loans.name: Moise

texts.fr:
Mr. Moise H. was born April 24, 1964, in Grand Popo in the department of Mono. He is married and a father of two: Casimir, 10, and Justine, 8, who both go to school. He is a professional driver but also manages a spare parts store for high-priced vehicles for his big brother. He is seeking this loan to start up his own shop to sell the same in-demand spare parts.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur H. Moise est né le 24 Avril 1964 à Grand popo dans le département du MONO. Il est marié et père de 02 enfants: Casimir 10ans en classe de CM1 et Justine 08 ans en classe de CE1. Il est conducteur de véhicule de profession, mais gère parallèlement à cette activité un magasin de vente de pièces de rechange pour véhicules de grande valeur appartenant à son grand frère. Il sollicite ce crédit, dans le but créer sa propre boutique pour vendre les même pièces de rechange d'engins très demandées par les clients.

loans.use: To purchase spark plug, carburator, and spare parts

loans.name: Kossigan

texts.fr:
Born in 1952, Mr. Kossigan S. abandoned his studies very early due to lack of financial support and returned to apprenticeship. A tailor by profession, this career became secondary due to the income he earns from the cultivation of peanuts and cassava. By doing this he manages to support his nine (9) children. According to his neighbors, he has proven to be a good manager. He is thus requesting a loan to expand his peanut and cassava field. With this loan he hopes to increase his business profit and therefore effectively contribute to the improvement of his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1952, Monsieur S. Kossigan a abandonné ses études très tôt par manque de support financier et est rentré dans l’apprentissage. Tailleur de profession, ce métier devient secondaire suite aux revenus qu’il escompte de la culture d’arachide et du manioc. Par ceci il arrive à supporter ses neuf (9) enfants. Il a fait preuve de bon gestionnaire selon son entourage. Ainsi, sollicite t-il un financement pour agrandir son champ d’arachide et de manioc. Par ce crédit il pense augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et par conséquent contribuer efficacement à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Expansion of peanut and cassava field

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina is 35 years old. She is a wife and the mother of three children who are in school. She is very enterprising and she has been trading to support her children’s education. She sells and supplies refrigerators and cookers to the staff of institutions. She makes it flexible for her loyal customers to take stock on credit and make regular payments, especially monthly workers. Augustina says this strategy is good because it enables her to make increased sales over a short period. She hopes the loan will inject more capital into her business to enable her to take cash delivery from her suppliers to reduce the cost of operations. She also hopes to increase her savings to support her children’s education. She is a member of the group called ‘Kae Awurade’ (meaning, remember the Lord) Trust Group.

loans.use: To purchase increased stock of refrigerators, electric and gas cookers.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia, 38 years old, is married with two kids who are in school. She has been selling grocery products for five years in the town to support her family. She says business is doing well, and she therefore wants to use the loan to buy more products to increase her inventory. Lydia believes this loan would help her increase her savings towards the welfare of her two children, who are in school now. She is a member of the group called ‘Nyame mmere' (meaning, God’s time). Members agree in principle to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products like canned fish and tomatoes, cocoa products, skim milk, body pomade, etc.

loans.name: Mamou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Mamou C. is 31 years old and mother of three (3) children (2 boys and 1 girl). She lives with her husband and their children in Médine, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Mrs. Mamou C. has been buying and selling wood for heating for the past 15 years, a trade she learned from her mother. Her business is well known and receives numerous orders, especially in the winter. To strengthen her financial means for this business, she decided join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. She has been a member of Soro Yiriwaso for the past three (3) years and has benefited from 3 group loans through an association of women from her district. This is now her first individual loan. All the preceding loans were refunded in time. With the current loan, she would like to buy a truck load of firewood for heating in order to satisfy the needs of her growing clientele. She supplies the town of Sikasso and its surrounding areas. Mrs. Mamou Cissé hopes to raise her monthly profits to 75.000 FCFA with which she intends to fund her expenses, to contribute to the family needs, to pay the interest on her loan and to invest the remainder in her business.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Madame Mamou C. a 31 ans et mère de trois (3) enfants (2 garçons et 1 filles), vit avec son époux et leurs enfants à Médine, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la République du Mali). Madame Mamou C. mène cette activité d’achat et vente de bois de chauffe depuis 15 ans et l’a appris auprès de sa maman. Elle jouit d’une grande réputation dans cette activité et reçoit beaucoup de commande surtout en saison d’hivernale. Pour pallier la faiblesse de ses moyens financiers, elle décida de s’endetter auprès de Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en rélation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis trois (3) ans et a bénéficié de 3 prêts solidaires (Pret de groupe) avec une association des femmes de son quartier et est maintenant à son premier prêt individuel. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Avec le prêt actuel, elle compte acheter un chargement de camion de bois de chauffe afin de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle qui ne cesse de croitre. Elle s’approvisionne dans les localités environnantes de la ville de Sikasso. Madame Mamou Cissé espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000 FCFA avec lequel, elle compte réaliser l’essentiel de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.

loans.use: Purchase of firewood for heating

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr:
Born in 1969 in Ghana, Ama G. was never able to attend school because her family was too poor to send her. She now lives in Lonvo with her husband and she practices a profession she truly enjoys: the preparation of palm oil. She cares for two of her sisters' children. Very much an entrepreneur, and having mastered her enterprise, she is asking for a loan that will allow her to purchase more palm nuts so that she may increase her palm oil production. With this loan, she is hoping to increase her profits and to better her family's living conditions from now on.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Née en 1969 au Ghana, Madame G. Ama n’a pas évolué dans le domaine scolaire par manque de support. Installé à Lonvo avec son mari depuis longtemps, elle a embrassé avec amour la préparation de l’huile de palme. Elle a en charge deux (2) enfants de ses sœurs. Très entreprenante, et maîtrisant bien son activité, elle sollicite un crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter de noix de palme afin d’augmenter la quantité de sa production. Par ce crédit, elle pense accroître ses revenus et contribuer davantage dans l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To purchase palm nuts.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is 32 and married. She has owned and operated a beauty salon for the past seven years. Rachel is a very skilled and talented hairdresser who adds beauty and style to the hair of her customers. She believes in the efficiency and effectiveness of service, therefore she wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, pomade, shampoo, activators, etc. to provide quality service to her customers. She hopes to increase her savings and include the sale of cosmetics. She is a member of the community group called “Nyame ye odo” (God is love) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as a social collateral to access loans and help each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, pomade, shampoo, activators, etc.

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr:
Born in 1984 in Nyigbe, Mrs. Massan E. was forced to abandon her studies in elementary school because her family lacked the money necessary to send her. She then began to work in the fields, in particular in the cultivation of corn,which helps her to earn a minimal profit. She has three children to care for and so she needs an industry that will earn her enough money to support them. She is asking for a loan that will be used to enlarge her fields and thereby increase her revenues. With this, she will be better able to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Née en 1984 à Nyigbé (P/Zio), Madame E. Massan a abandonné ses études primaires par manque de support. Elle s’est lancée aux travaux champêtres notamment à la culture du maïs qui lui procure un minimum de revenu. Ayant trois (3) enfants à sa charge, Madame E. Massan arrive à subvenir à leurs besoins nécessaires. Elle sollicite un financement qui va lui permettre d’augmenter sa superficie cultivée de même que ses revenus. Alors, elle pourra avoir les moyens suffisants pour contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To enlarge her fields.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 48-year-old wife and mother of five children who are in school. She has been a food vendor for three years. She prepares and sells banku (locally dish prepared from milled maize and eaten with all kinds of local soups). It is a delicacy most Ghanaians eat every day either as breakfast, lunch or dinner. Janet’s business is doing well and she wants to expand her operations to serve more customers. She therefore wants to use the loan to buy more maize grains, vegetables and assorted meat for her operation. She hopes this loan will help her increase her savings for the children’s fees. Janet is a member of the group called “Nyame ye odo” (God is love). Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bags of dried maize grains, vegetables, assorted meat, etc.

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr:
Mr. Yao Gossoou was born in 1978. He was forced to abandon his studies in High School because his family lacked the funds to support his education. He learned refrigerator reparation and other similar devices. However, he did not have the funds necessary to purchase the tools he needed to practice this profession. And so, he turned to farming, in particular corn. The father of two children, he is able to support his family because of this enterprise. Currently, he is asking for a loan that will help him to enlarge his field thereby helping to contribute to the improvement of his family's living conditions.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Monsieur G. Yao est né en 1978. Il a arrêté ses études en classe de seconde par manque de moyen financier et se retrouve en apprentissage. Il a appris la réparation des congélateurs et autres appareils de froid. Mais n’ayant pas les moyens nécessaires pour acheter le matériel nécessaire pour l’exercice de son métier, il est revenu au village pour embrasser la culture du maïs. Père de deux (2) enfants, il arrive à subvenir aux besoins du foyer grâce au revenu de son champ. A présent, il sollicite un crédit qui va lui permettre d’agrandir son champ afin d’augmenter ses revenu et par conséquent contribuer davantage à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To enlarge his field

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a 46-year-old widow with three children who are in school. She is a very hard-working and resourceful mother. She is a retailer of charcoal in her neighborhood. Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all the traditional Ghanaian homes. Janet obtains her supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages of Koforidua and retails them to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy bulk supply of charcoal to retail to her customers. She hopes to increase her savings to pay for her children’s educational fees. She belongs to the community group called “Nyame ye odo” (God is love) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as a social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of charcoal.

loans.name: Albert

texts.fr:
Albert H. was born on January 16, 1977 in Porto-Novo, the political capital of BENIN. He is married and the father of two children: Joseph, age 3, and Merveille, age 8 months. A machinist of eleven years, he repairs sewing machines. He also sells used sewing machines. Given the increased demand of his customers, he is requesting as his second loan an amount of 100,000 francs in order to satisfy the burgeoning demand of his customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

H. Albert est né le 16 Janvier 1977 à Porto-Novo la capitale politique du BENIN. Marié et père de 02 enfants: Joseph 03ans et Merveille 08 mois. Machiniste de profession depuis 11 ans, il répare les machines à coudre et fait également la vente des machines à coudre d'occasion. Vue la demande accrue de ses clients, il sollicite pour son deuxième crédit une somme de 100 000 francs afin de satisfaire la demande de plus en plus croissante de sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy two used sewing machines

loans.name: Selina

texts.en: Selina is a 34-year-old trader. She is married with three children. It is her daily dream to provide quality education for her children to give them a better future life. Selina owns and operates a grocery shop with items like rice, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, assorted biscuits, candies, evaporated milk, etc. She wants to use the loan to buy cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned foods and drinks and cooking oil to increase her stock of goods. With an increased stock of different varieties, she hopes to make more income to provide for the educational needs of her children. She belongs to a community group called “Nyame ye odo” (meaning God is love) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as a social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned foods and drinks, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Diane Ines

texts.fr:
Born on June 26, 1978 in Tokpa Domè, in MONO County, Ms. Diane Ines H. is married to a photographer  technician and is the mother of three children: Fèmi, age 7, in the 1st grade; Nikè, age 4; and Farèl, age 2.  A seamstress by profession, she got started in distributing staple foodstuffs three years ago.  She is requesting this loan to satisfy her customers and also to grow her market share.  

 Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Née le 26 juin 1978 à Tokpa Domè dans le département du MONO, dame H. Diane Ines est mariée à un technicien photographe et est mère de 03 enfants: Fèmi 07ans en classe de CP, Nikè 04 ans et Farèl 02 ans. Couturière de profession, elle s'est mise dans la distribution des produits vivriers depuis 03 ans. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour satisfaire ses cleints et  aussi pour accroître sa part de marché.

loans.use: To buy 2 sacks of rice, 2 drums of peanut oil, and 2 sacks of corn

loans.name: Yawavi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Yawavi A. was born in 1968 in Gape Kove. Her main economic activity if selling food supplies such as "Kom" a popular corn based dish consumed by those in her neighborhood. The mother of five children, she is able to take care of household expenses thanks to her profits from this business. A good business-woman, she is asking for a loan that will allow her to purchase more bags of corn, fish-oil, tomatoes and other food products she uses to prepare "Kom." She hopes that this will help satisfy customer demand and increase profits.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Madame A. Yawavi est née en 1968 à Gapé Kové (P/Zio). Son activité principale est la vente de denrée alimentaire : « Kom » fait à base de maïs et très apprécié dans sa localité. Mère de cinq (5) enfants, elle arrive à contribuer aux charges du foyer grâce à ses revenus. Très bonne gestionnaire, elle sollicite un financement qui va lui permettre d’acheter des sacs de maïs, huile poissons, tomate et autres pour sa préparation. Dans le but de satisfaire sa clientèle et augmenter ses revenus.

loans.use: The purchase and sale of bags of corn, tomatoes, rice and fish.

loans.name: Fatoumata Modibo

texts.fr:
Fatoumata S. is 43 years old and the mother of five children (two boys and three girls). She lives with her husband and their children, renting in Hamdallaye, one of the districts of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having worked in a lot of businesses unsuccessfully, she got started six years ago in this business, purchasing and selling beauty products and various items. She works at the grand marketplace of Sikasso. To offer a varied range of products to her customers, she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. She has been making voluntary savings deposits at Soro Yiriwaso for two months, and she is on her first PIC (individual commercial loan).

With this loan, she intends to buy 5 boxes of hair cream of different grades, 5 women's handbags, 10 coolers, 5 dozen coffee mugs, 5 boxes of bath soap, and 5 pairs of shoes. She gets her inventory in Bamako, Bobo Dioulasso (Republic of Burkina Faso), and often Lomé (Republic of Togo). With this loan, she envisions realizing a profit of 125,000 francs CFA, which will serve to cover the loan interest, to help with family expenses, and to invest in her business. She now wants to make the most of this Soro Yiriwaso loan to become a major merchant in the marketplace where she operates, in order satisfy her customers, most of whom are women.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Fatoumata S. a 43 ans et mère de cinq (5) enfants (2 garçons et 3 filles), vit avec son époux et leurs enfants en location à Hamdallaye, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, elle s’est initié à cette activité d’achat et vente des produits de beauté et divers il y a maintenant six (6) ans. Elle mène son activité au grand marché de Sikasso. Pour proposer une gamme variée de produits à sa clientèle, elle a décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elle éffectue des dépôts d’épargne volontaire à Soro Yiriwaso depuis deux (2) mois et elle est à son premier prêt individuel commerçant (PIC)..

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 5 cartons de pommade de qualités différentes, 5 sacs à main pour les femmes, 10 glacières, 5 douzaines de bole à café, 5 cartons de savon de toilette et 5 paires de chaussures. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako, Bobo Dioulasso (répulique du Burkina Faso) et souvent à Lomé (république du Togo). Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice de 125 000 FCFA qui servira à payer les interets du pret, à contribuer aux dépenses de la famille et investir le reste dans son activité. Maintenant, elle veut profiter de ce prêt de Soro Yiriwaso pour devenir une grande commerçante au niveau du marché où elle opère afin de satisfaire sa clientèle dont la plupart sont des femmes.

loans.use: To buy beauty products and kitchen utensiles

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 37-year-old widow with three children. Her children are currently in school. To support her household, she has been hawking cosmetics in the neighborhood to her loyal clients. She says selling cosmetics is very lucrative, and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make good income for the family’s needs. Mary is a member of the group called Isaiah. Members agree to guarantee for each other as a social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of cosmetics.

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ami A. was born in 1978, she is married and the mother of two. The responsibility of raising her children means that she cannot sit with her arms crossed and do nothing. This is why she began to work in sales, corn specifically. This industry has allowed her to take care of her family expenses. In order to satisfy customer demand, she is asking for a loan that will help her to keep her stock consistent and better prepared during the "hungry season" between harvests when supplies are low. This will help her to increase her profits and to aide in the betterment of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Madame A. Ami est née en 1978, mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Sa lourde responsabilité ne lui permet pas de rester les bras croisés sans rien faire. C’est ainsi qu’elle se lance dans la vente du maïs, qui lui réussir bien et arrive à contribuer aux charges du foyer. Afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, elle sollicite un financement qui va lui servir de faire un stockage consistant de maïs pour revendre en période de soudure. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et mieux contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille

loans.use: Stock and sale of corn in the event of low supplies during the "hungry season" between harvests.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Born in 1974 in Adokpoe, Mrs. Yawa A. is married and the mother of four. A seamstress by training, she faced problems finding stable work and so she began a business stocking and selling corn which provides enough profit to take care of her household expenses. In order to satisfy customer demand and to increase sales, she is applying for a loan that will help her to keep her stock of corn consistent.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Née en 1974 à Adokpoé (P/Zio), Madame A. Yawa est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Couturière de formation, elle a constaté la non rentabilité de son métier et s’est lancée dans le stockage et la vente de maïs qui lui procure un revenu nécessaire pour contribuer aux charges du ménage. Afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et augmenter ses revenus, elle sollicite un financement qui va lui servir de faire un stockage consistant de maïs.

loans.use: Stock and sale of corn.

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
Born in G. Kopé in 1973, Mr. Komi G. has three children. His main job is farming. However, due to his infertile farmland, he no longer has good crop yields and this is disastrous for him. To resolve this problem, he is requesting a loan which will allow him to purchase fertilizers for his farmland. This will lead to an increase in his production, allowing him to meet his customers’ demands.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

Né à G. Kopé en1973, Monsieur G. Komi est père de trois (3) enfants. Son activité principale est l’agriculture. Devant l’infertilité de ses sols, il n’arrive plus à un bon rendement et cela lui est fatal. Pour résoudre ce problème, il sollicite un financement qui lui servir d’acheter des engrais et fertilisants pour ses sols. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter sa production et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers

loans.name: Komivi

texts.fr:
Mr. Komivi G. was born in 1986. Single with no children, no one helped him learn a trade, so he decided to put the vast fertile lands of his father to good use. Even though he grows several different kinds of crops, his cash crop is corn. He is a very successful farmer. He is requesting a loan which will help him increase his revenue by allowing him to obtain more arable land. By doing so, he will be in a better position to improve his parents’ living conditions.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur G. Komivi est né en 1986. Célibataire sans enfant, il n’a personne pour l’aider à apprendre un métier, il a décidé de mettre en valeur les vastes terres fertiles de son père. Malgré les multiples cultures pratiquées, il met en exergue la culture du maïs qui lui procure tant de revenu. Il maîtrise et gère bien ses activités. Il sollicite un financement qui pourra l’aider à accroître son revenu par l’agrandissement de sa surface cultivée. Ainsi pourra t-il contribuer plus à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de ses parents.

loans.use: To obtain more arable land

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr:
Mr. Komla A. was born in 1962, in Boga in the Zio Prefecture. A farmer by trade, he grows teak, which is highly sought after, as well as other crops. He has been able to meet his family’s needs thanks to the revenue he earns from farming. He has proven to be good at managing money and paid back his first loan in full, with no problems. He is requesting another loan which will allow him to purchase more teak plains so he can increase the size of his plantation. This will help him to work old plantations, allowing him to increase his revenue and thus improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur A. Komla est né à Boga en 1962 dans la préfecture de Zio. Agriculture de profession, il cultive le teck qui est très convoité dans le pays en plus de quelques vivriers. Il arrive à subvenir aux besoins du foyer grâce au revenu de ses activités. Il fait preuve de bon gestionnaire et a bien remboursé son premier crédit sans incident. De nouveau il sollicite un financement qui lui servira d’acheter de nouveaux plans de teck afin d’agrandir sa plantation. Ceci pourra l’aider à exploiter les anciennes plantations pour avoir de revenu et contribuer davantage à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of new teak plains

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Born in 1948 in Kévé in the Avé Prefecture, Mrs. Abra A. is a widow with five children. She has had to manage her household expenses by herself and she inherited a field from her husband upon his death. She has worked tirelessly by farming corn which provides her with necessary funds. Very concerned about the futures of her children, she is requesting a loan which will allow her to purchase fertilizer so she can make her land more fertile, thus increasing her crop yield.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1948 à Kévé dans la préfecture de l’Avé, Madame A. Abra est veuve et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Seule devant ces charges, son défunt mari n’a laissé comme héritage un champ. Elle s’est acharnée dans la culture du maïs qui la procure le revenu nécessaire. Très soucieuse de l’avenir des enfants, elle sollicite un financement qui lui servira d’acheter des engrais et fertilisants afin de rendre plus fertile son sol et augmenter sa production.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Atape

texts.fr:
Mrs. Atapé A. was born in Lonvo in 1949. Having not received an education due to a lack of financial support, she got involved in farming. Her main crop is corn, which provides her with minimal income. Even though she has been a widow for some years, she has nonetheless been able to meet the needs of her son’s children, who are under her care. She is requesting a loan which will help her obtain more arable land. By doing so, she will increase her revenue and thus be in a better position to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Atapé est née à Lonvo en 1949. N’ayant pas été l’école par manque de support financier, elle s’est donnée à l’agriculture. Sa principale culture est le maïs qui lui procure de revenu minimum. Veuve depuis quelques années, elle arrive à subvenir aux besoins des enfants de ses fils à sa charge. Elle sollicite un financement qui pourra l’aider à augmenter sa surface cultivée. C’est ainsi qu’elle peut augmenter son chiffre d’affaires pour mieux contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To obtain more arable land

loans.name: Hermanas Unidas Group

texts.en:
Estama M. has found a unique niche in her local community juS.outside of Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic. When someone has an old or broken piece of furniture, they take it to her. She has begun a small business repairing chairs, sofas, beds, and other furniture. Left by her husband several years ago, Estama has found herself in the same position as many women here in the Dominican and in her home country, Haiti. She is left to provide for her two boys (ages 14, 16) with whatever means she can. The money from this loan will go towards purchasing paint, sand paper, various tools, as well as several old beds that may be refurbished and sold. She aspires to continue growing her business, so that someday she might be able to own her own shop that she can work out of.

Estama is one of the leaders of the 10 person micro bank Hermanas Unidas, which means "United Sisters". All ten women in the bank are Haitian immigrants who have come to earn a living in the Dominican informal sector. These unique entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, promising to cover one another if someone fails on a payment, thus allowing them to access funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own. The concept of this group bank paying their loan together is to reduce the risk of one person defaulting due to the strong peer pressure from their fellow bank members. As these 10 women embark upon their firS.ever loan from Esperanza, we are confident that they will all succeed in bettering their lives and the lives of their families with this loan. Their businesses are simple, but offer a stream of income that could never have been accomplished without such a loan for initial capital. Several of the women sell clothes and shoes in the street, and a couple of them will offer housecleaning services and beauty supplies.

On behalf of Estama M., the Hermanas Unidas group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support and awareness of the global issue of poverty, in which your efforts are helping to make a difference

loans.use: To purchase, paint, sandpaper, tools, and several old beds to be refurbished and sold.

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ami A. was born in 1979 in Nyigbé in the Zio prefecture. She had to drop out of school due to a lack of funds. Married with 4 children, she has been able to contribute toward her family’s household expenses thanks to revenue she earns from farming. She is requesting a loan which will allow her to obtain more farmland, and thus, increase her revenue. By doing so, she will be in a better position to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Ami est née en 1979 à Nyigbé dans la préfecture de Zio. Elle a arrêté ses études par manque de support financier. Mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants, elle arrive à contribuer aux charges du ménage grâce aux revenus de son agriculture. Elle sollicite un financement qui va lui permettre d’augmenter sa surface cultivée et son revenu. Ainsi elle pourra mieux contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To obtain more arable land

loans.name: Vida Group

texts.en: Emilia Torrez C. (pictured far right) is the president of her Esperanza Bank of Hope, Vida ("life").  She is the mother of seven children--aged 22, 21, 18, 15, 14, 10, and 9--and is putting her loan funds towards starting a well-stocked underwear store.  Her primary goal for the  future is to work hard so that she and her children can see the business grow.

loans.use: Sale of women's underwear

loans.name: Lucie

texts.fr:
Ms. Luicie D. was born on August 5, 1972 in Okou-sèmè. She is married to a welder and is the mother of three children: Marcos, age 10, Lazare age 7, and Florence, age 5. A hairdresser by profession, she has also been selling various common consumables for eight years. The location of her house is a real asset for her. Of good character, she is devoted to this business, which enables her to cover a large portion of family expenses. She is requesting this loan to respond to the ever-growing demands of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Dame D. Luicie est née le 05 Août 1972 à Okou-sèmè. Elle est mariée à un soudeur et est mère de 03 enfants: Marcos 10 ans, Lazare 07 ans et Florence 05 ans. Coiffeuse de profession elle vend également divers articles de consommation courante depuis huit ans. La situation géographique de sa maison est un véritable atout pour elle. D'une bonne moralité elle est dévouée à cette activité qui lui permet de couvrir la grande partie des charges familiales. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour répondre à la demande sans cesse croissante de sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy 2 boxed of canned food, 1 box of soap, and 4 dozen sandals

loans.name: Léontine

texts.fr:
Born around 1956, Ms. Léontine B. is originally from Zangnanado, in the AGONLIN region in the middle of Bénin, in ZOU County. She is a widow and the mother of five children: Honorat, Jean, Josiane, Odette, and Angenor. Five years ago, she used to sell ready-to-eat meals in front of her house. This business was not entirely satisfactory to her. So, she decided to turn towards other work. This is how she got started selling roasted acajou nuts (from the mahogany tree), condiments of all sorts, boiled corn mash, and other items. To bolster her business level, in order to meet the needs of her customers, she is here to request this loan of 100,000 francs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Née vers les années 1956, dame B. Léontine est originaire de Zangnanado dans la région d'AGONLIN, au centre du Bénin dans le département du ZOU. Elle est veuve et mère de cinq enfants: Honorat, Jean, Josiane, Odette, et Angenor. Il y a 05 ans elle s'exerçait dans la vente de repas prêt à manger devant sa maison. Cette activité ne lui donnait pas entière satisfaction. Elle donc décidé de s'orienter vers d'autres activités. Ainsi, elle s'est lancée dans la vente de noix d'acajou grillées, de condiments de tous genres, de la pâte de maïs bouillie et autres articles. Pour renforcer le niveau de son activité afin de répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle, elle vient solliciter ce crédit de 100 000francs.

loans.use: To buy 12 sacks of acajou nuts

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.fr:
