Elle est spécialiée dans la distribution des sous vêtements, des habits de femmes et d'enfants qu'elle achète à Lomé au Togo. Face aux difficultés financières actuelles, elle sollicite pour son troisième crédit une somme de 200 000 francs afin de répondre aux demandes sans cesse croissante de sa clientèle.

loans.use:
Purchase of 10 dozen women's underwear and 15 dozen children's garments

Achat de 10 douzaines de sous vêtement pour femme et de 15 douzaines d'habits d'enfants

loans.name: Cathérine

texts.fr:
Mrs. Cathérine H. was born around 1973 in Porto-Novo, the political capital of Benin. Married to a cook by the name of Blaise Boko, she is the mother of two children: Romuald (13) and Bermine (11). Mrs. H. retails various items such as milk, sugar, soap, and biscuits in the biggest open-air market of Benin, Dantokpa. Her niece, Valerie (14), who is not enrolled in school, often helps out with the business.

Currently experiencing some difficulty with stocking her shop, Mrs. H. is asking for this loan in order to satisfy the demand of her clientele and raise her family’s standard of living.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Dame H. Cathérine est née vers les années1973 à Porto-Novo dans la capitale politique du BENIN. Mariée à un cuisinier du nom de BOKO Blaise, elle est mère de 02 enfants: Romuald et Bermine âgés respectivement de 13 ans et de 11 ans. Elle est souvent aidée dans son activité par sa nièce Valerie âgée de 14 ans et non scolarisée. Elle est une revendeuse de divers articles tels que le lait, le sucre, le savon et les biscuits dans le plus grand marché du BENIN Dantokpa.

Eprouvant actuellement des difficultés pour s'approvisionner, elle sollicite alors ce crédit afin de satisfaire à la demande de sa clientèle et d'augmenter le niveau de vie de sa famille.

loans.use:
Purchase of 3 cases of sugar, 3 cases of soap, 2 cases of biscuits, 2 cases of concentrated milk, and 2 cases of evaporated milk

Achat de 03 cartons de sucres, de 03 cartons de savons, de 02 cartons de biscuits, de 02 cartons de lait concentré sucré et de 02 cartons de lait concentré non sucré.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.fr:
Born around 1968 in Sakété in the Plateau Department in the southeast of Benin, Mrs. Josephine A.'s ethnicity is Nago. She is married and the mother of 5 children.

Possessed of a great deal of experience in the distribution of all sorts of cloth and of bazin (used for tie-dyes), Mrs. Josephine A. has a shop in the used car lot at Sèkandji. In order to respond to orders she has received and satisfy the needs of her clientele, she is requesting her third loan in the amount of 350,000 francs (US$ 850).

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née vers les années 1968 à Sakété dans le département du Plateau au Sud-est du Bénin, dame A. Josephine est d'origine Nago. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants.

D'une grande expérience dans la distribution des tissus de tout genre et des tissus bazins, dame A. Josephine possède une boutique au parc de vente de Véhicules d'occasion de Sèkandji. Afin de répondre aux commandes reçues et de donner satisfaction à sa clientèle, elle sollicite pour son troisième crédit une somme de 350 000 francs.

loans.use:
Purchase of 8 lengths of cloth "Hitarget" and 1 bale of damask "bazin"

Achat de 8 pièces de tissus HITARGET et d'une balle de tissu Bazin.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Alidé - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Agathe

texts.fr:
Born around 1976 in Aguegue in the valley of the Ouémé in the southeast of Benin, Mrs. Agathe Agoussou is married and the mother of four children: Marie (16) is an apprentice seamstress; Mahugnon (14) is an apprentice mason; Roger (11) is in 7th grade, and Mireille (9) is in 4th grade.

Mrs. Agathe Agoussou prepares porridge made out of corn in the mornings and also distributes sacks of corn. Since she has financial difficulties, she is requesting her second loan to bolster her business and also to satisfy the needs of her customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née vers les années 1976 à AGUEGUE dans la vallée de l'Ouémé au Sud-est du Bénin, dame A. Agathe est mariée et mère de 4 enfants: Marie 16 ans apprentie couturière, Mahugnon 14 ans apprenti maçon, Roger 11 ans en classe de Sixième au cours secondaire et Mireille 9 ans en classe de CE2.

Dame A. Agathe prépare la bouillie à base de maïs les matins et fait aussi la distribution des sacs de maïs. En difficultés financières, elle sollicite son deuxième crédit pour renforcer l'activité et aussi pour satisfaire à la demande de sa clientèle.

loans.use:
Purchase of 4 sacks of corn

Achat de 4 sacs de maïs

loans.name: Rébecca

texts.fr:
Born on April 13, 1969 in Aguégué in Ouémé County in the southeast of Benin, Mrs. Rébecca A. is married and the mother of three children: Clarisse (19) is a seamstress and lives independently; Paulin (16) is in 11th grade, and Marlyse (10) is in 7th grade.

Mrs. Rébecca A. buys cloth that comes from Lomé, Togo, then distributes some and displays the rest in her shop. In order to increase her business capital and respond appropriately to the demands of her clientele, she is requesting her second loan in the amount of 180,000 francs (US$ 450).

Née le 13 avril 1969 à Aguégué dans le département de l'Ouémé au Sud-est du Bénin, dame A. Rébecca est mariée et mère de trois enfants Clarisse âgée de 19 ans est Couturière et n'est plus à sa charge; Paulin âgé de 16 ans est en classe de Seconde au cours secondaire et Marlyse âgée de 10 ans est en classe de Sixième du secondaire.

Dame A. Rébecca achète des tissus en provenance de Lomé au TOGO et procède ensuite à la distribution avant de venir étaler le reste dans sa boutique. Afin d'augmenter son capital et de répondre convenablement à la demande de la clientèle, elle sollicite pour son deuxième crédit une somme de 180 000 francs.

loans.use:
Purchase of 20 lengths of various sorts of cloth

Achat de 20 pièces de tissus de tout genre

loans.name: Limanta

texts.fr:
Born around 1979 in Agblangandan in Ouémé County in the southeast of Benin, Mrs. Limanta B. retails corn, dried beans, and condiments. She is married and the mother of three children for whom she is no longer responsible. To increase her capacity for distribution of goods and bolster her business, she is requesting her third loan in the amount of 150,000 francs (US$ 375).

Née vers 1979 à Agblangandan dans le Département de l'Ouémé au Sud-est du Bénin, dame B. Limanta est revendeuse de maïs, du haricot et des condiments. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants qui ne sont plus à sa charge. Pour accroître sa capacité de distribution et renforcer son activité, elle sollicite pour son troisième crédit une somme de 150 000 francs.

loans.use:
Purchase of 3 sacks of corn and 2 sacks of dried beans

Achat de 3 sacs de maïs et de 2 sacs de haricot.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Alidé - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Mahuna Leah

texts.fr:
Mrs. Mahuna Leah B. was born around 1959 in Agbalilamè in the community of Sèmè-Podji, Ouémé Department, in the southeast of Benin. She is married and the mother of 7 children. She sells various sorts of vegetable oil in Jerry cans as well as cereals and various other items.

Mrs. Mahuna Leah B. presently has difficulty keeping her shop stocked as the items she sells are in great demand. Faced with this situation, she is requesting this loan so as to respond to the needs of her clientele.

Dame B. Mahuna Leah est née vers 1959 à Agbalilamè dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji dans le département de l'Ouémé au Sud-est du Bénin. Elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle vend diverses d'huiles végétales en bidon, des céréales et divers articles.

Dame B. Mahuna Leah éprouve actuellement quelques difficultés dans l'approvisionnement de ses produits qui font l'objet d'une grande demande. Face à cette situation, elle sollicite ce crédit pour répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Alidé - Oct 22, 2008)

She is requesting this loan to bolster her business inventory and respond to the needs of her clientele.

Dame D. Judith Olga est née le 23 Avril 1983 à Cotonou dans le Département du Littoral. Elle est revendeuse de petits matériaux de construction et des pièces de rechange. Elle est mariée et mère d'un garçon nommé Hector âgé de 2 ans. Elle demande ce crédit pour renforcer sa capacité d'approvisionnement et faire face à la demande de sa clientèle.

Purchase of 15 boxes of glue and masonry accessories

loans.name: Colombiano

texts.fr:
Born around 1973 in Pobè in Plateau County in the southeast of Benin, Mr. Colombiano D. S. is married and the father of two children, Abdel (12) in 7th grade and Nazaire (7) in second grade. Trained carpenter, he purchases massive wooden beams in Tchèti, a village in the center of Benin, to use for making furniture which he then sells. He also sells charcoal. He is asking for this loan for financial reasons so that he can fill some orders he has received.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née vers 1973 à Pobè dans le département du Plateau au Sud-est du Bénin, Monsieur D. S. Colombiano est marié et père de 2 enfants Abdel âgé de 12 ans en classe de Sixième au secondaire et Nazaire âgé de 7 ans est écolier en classe de CE1. Menuisier de profession, il achète à Tchèti un village du centre Bénin des madriers pour la fabrication des meubles qu'il revend. Il vend également du charbon de bois. Il sollicite ce crédit pour des raisons financières afin d'exécuter les commandes qu'il a reçues.

loans.use:
Purchase of 6 massive wooden beams and 20 sacks of charcoal

Achat de 6 madriers de bois massif et de 20 sacs de charbon.

loans.name: Mathilde Yemalin

texts.fr:
Born around 1967 in Cotonou, Mrs. Mathilde Yemalin G. is married to Mr. Comlan Ameyibo, a mason, with whom she lives in Mondocomey, a neighborhood of the town of Seme-Podji. She is the mother of two children, a boy and a girl, both enrolled in school. Mrs. G., a housewife, began buying and selling bottles and other used plastics.

In fact, she purchases bottles and empty plastic items that are not going to be reused from households and in one of the central marketplaces of Benin. She cleans them and resells them to customers who very often come from Nigeria. The latter use the containers to hold various local products such as cosmetics, foods, and medicines. Mrs. G. is requesting this loan to bolster her busines.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née vers 1967 à Cotonou, dame G. Mathilde Yemalin est mariée à Monsieur AMEYIBO Comlan, maçon de profession avec qui elle vit à Mondocomey, un quartier de la commune de SEME-PODJI. Elle est mère de 02 enfants, une fille et un garçon, tous deux scolarisés. Ménagère, elle s'est lancée dans la commercialisation des bouteilles et plastiques usagés.

En effet, elle achète dans les ménages et dans l'un des marchés du centre du BENIN, des bouteilles et plastiques vides qui ne sont plus destinés à aucun usage qu'elle met au propre et les revend à des clients qui viennent très souvent du Nigéria. Ces derniers s'en servent pour stocker les différents produits locaux tels les produits cosmétique, alimentaire et médicaux. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son activité.

loans.use:
Purchase of 5 sacks of plastic mineral water bottles, 3 sacks of assorted plastics, and 10 sacks of used bottles

Achat de 05 sacs de plastiques d'eau minérale, de 03 sacs de diverses formes de plastiques et de 10 sacs de bouteilles usagées.

loans.name: Maïmounatou

texts.fr:
Born around 1982 in Cotonou in Littoral County in the south of Benin, Mrs. Maïmounatou L. is married to Razack Oke, a transit agent at the Autonomous Port of Cotonou. Mrs. Maïmounatou L. is the mother of two children: Idriss (8) in grade 3 and Awèni (4). A skilled cook, she prepares rice, beans and voandzou (a type of groundnut) which she sells in a little shop. In view of her ever growing clientele, she is asking for this loan to grow her business.

Compte tenu de la clientèle grandissante; elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son activité.

loans.use:
Purchase of 2 sacks of rice, one sack of voandzou (a type of groundnut), and one sack of dried beans

Achat de 2 sacs de riz, d'un sac de voandzou et d'un sac de haricot

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 30 year-old Maria S.. She is married and has three children, ages 3 and 6.

In 2008, Maria established her grocery business. She opens her business six days a week and 11 hours a day. Maria requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, beans and vegetables in bulk.. In the future, Maria plans to to increase the quantity and range of the stock.. She thanks you for your support.

The Swahili word for this type of outside shop, or stall, is "genge." A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chili, oil, rice and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal, and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, beans and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 45-year-old Joyce N.. She is married and has three children with ages between 18 and 25.

In 2005, Joyce established her fish business. Working six days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about US $100 every month from this business. She is assisted by her husband and children. Joyce requires a loan in order to purchase additional fish. In the future, Joyce plans to to increase the quantity and range of the stock.. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale-and-leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish.

Sira D. est une dame qui fait du petit commerce. Elle vend des beignets et des mangues. Avec cette activité génératrice de revenus, cette mére de famille aide son époux à subvenir aux besoins de base de la famille; elle habite le populaire quartier de Belfort au centre de Ziguinchor.

Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Asumta D.. She is married and has three children with ages between 4 and 15.

He would like to increase his inventory before the winter season arrives, when the demand for wood is very high. With this loan he will be able to considerably increase his revenue and support his family.

Donc aec ce crédit il pourra augmenter de façon considérable ses revenus et faire face aux charges familiales.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 29-year-old Asha M.. She is married and has three children with ages between 4 and 9.

In 2005, Asha established her salon business. She earns about US $90 every month from this business. Asha requires a loan in order to expand her range of haircare products and wigs. In the future, Asha plans to to increase the quantity and range of the stock.. She thanks you for your support.

Hair, hair and more hair! This is the place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or plaited, and made to look like your own.

loans.name: Youssouph

loans.name: Hosiana

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 23-year-old Hosiana B..

In 2008, Hosiana established her poultry business. She is assisted by her husband. Hosiana requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock of chicks and feed. In the future, Hosiana plans to to open another business. She thanks you for your support.

Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. "Kuku" means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons.

First, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two, and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiply naturally! Second, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Third, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein.

I’m sure there are hundreds of other reasons why raising kuku is so popular (maybe they are friendlier than other animals? Prettier?), but this is all time and space will allow.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks and feed.
