She has two other dependents, who live with her because they are orphans. In 1997, Hawa established her grocery business. Working 6 days a week and 14 hours a day, she earns about US $330 every month from this business. She is assisted by her brother, sister and three employees.

Hawa has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, beans and vegetebles in bulk. In the future, Hawa plans to to open another business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, beans and vegetable in bulk.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 50-year-old Mariam Kapelewere. She is married with six children, whose ages range from 16 to 30. In 2004, Mariam established her clothing and cosmetics business. Working five days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about 300 USD every month. Mariam has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA; she is now seeking a new loan in order to purchase additional stock of cloth and cosmetics. In the future, Mariam plans to to open another business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania, using a sale and leaseback microfinance model as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Because customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, they are deemed not creditworthy by financial institutions, leading low incomes and inadequate access to basic needs and services. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women: when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the client, extends a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of cloth and cosmetics.

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 50-year-old Theresia M.. She is married and has five children between the ages of 13 and 20. She also has two dependents who live with her because they are orphans and she has taken them in. In 2002, Theresia established her grocery business. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 30 USD every month from this business. She is assisted by her husband. Theresia is seeking a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, beans and vegetables in bulk. In the future, Theresia plans to renovate the building which houses her store. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania, using a sale and leaseback microfinance model as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Because customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, they are deemed not creditworthy by financial institutions, leading low incomes and inadequate access to basic needs and services. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women: when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the client, extends a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks af beans, rice, and vegetable in bulk.

loans.name: Janifa

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 45 year-old Janifa P.. She is married and has six children (ages 17 to 31). She also has two dependents who live with her because they are at school in the area. In 2005, Janifa established her charcoal business. Janifa is seeking a loan in order to purchase additional stock of charcoal. In the future, Janifa plans to to increase the quantity and variety of her charcoal stock. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania, using a sale and leaseback microfinance model as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Because customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, they are deemed not creditworthy by financial institutions, leading low incomes and inadequate access to basic needs and services. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women: when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the client, extends a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Hotensia

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 36 year-old Hotensia K.. She is married and has three children (ages three through 16). In 1998, Hotensia established her salon business. Working seven days a week, 10 hours a day, she earns about 70 USD every month. She is assisted at the salon by one employee. Hotensia is seeking a loan in order to expand her range of haircare products and wigs. In the future, Hotensia plans to to open new business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania, using a sale and leaseback microfinance model as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Because customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, they are deemed not creditworthy by financial institutions, leading low incomes and inadequate access to basic needs and services. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women: when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the client, extends a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment.

loans.use: To expand her selection of hair care products and wigs.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 23-year-old Rehema M.. She has no children. Rehema owns a shop which sells DVD movies. She works six days a week and ten hours a day, and she is assisted by one employee. Rehema is seeking a loan in order to purchase additional DVD movies for her shop. In the future, Rehema plans to to open another business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania, using a sale and leaseback microfinance model as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Because customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, they are deemed not creditworthy by financial institutions, leading low incomes and inadequate access to basic needs and services. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women: when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the client, extends a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment.

loans.use: To purchase additional DVD movies for a shop.

loans.name: Souleymane

texts.fr:
This young entrepreneur is involved in the sale of basic necessity items; rice, oils etc. He maintains a general grocery store in the Kadior district. He is requesting this loan to increase his business and meet the ever increasing demand for products of mass consumption.

Translated from French by Dave Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

Ce jeune entrepreneur intervient dans l'offre de produits de premiéres nécessité : riz, huile etc Il tient une alimentation générale au quartier de Kadior. Il sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son commerce et faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante de produits de consommation de masse

loans.use: Store Improvements

loans.name: Ansoumana Faye

texts.fr:
Mr. Ansoumana Faye S. sells a range of locally produced products including palm oil, which he brings in from the weekly market at Sao Domingo, 45 kilometers from Ziguinchor. With this business he is able to support his large family. He is requesting this loan to allow him to increase his inventory and his revenue.

Translated from French by Dave Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

Ansoumana Faye S. vend divers produits locaux dont l'huile de palme qu'il fait venir du marché hebdomadaire de Sao Domingo à 45 km de Ziguinchor. Avec ce commerce il entretient sa nombreuse famille. Il sollicite ce prêt pour augmenter ses revenus en renforçant son stock.

loans.use: Sale of  Local Products

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr:
This young Ziguinchor woman is a highly reputed dressmaker. She is requesting this loan to purchase sewing materials and fabric to prepare her ready to wear apparel. The demand for her products is strong during summer vacation in Senegal.

Translated from French by Dave Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

Cette jeune ziguinchoroise est une coutriére trés réputée. Elle demande ce financement pour acheter de la mercerie et des tissus afin de confectionner des prêts-à-porter. La demande est forte avec la période des grandes vacances au Sénégal

loans.use: Expand dressmaking activities

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina S. is a 24-year-old married woman who lives in Tikhedewol, Lalitpur. Tikhedewol is one of the growing towns in Lalitpur. Most people in this region are engaged in small business. Mrs. S. lives with her husband and one daughter. Her daughter is studying in grade 3.

Mrs. S. 's husband's name is Kumar. He is a photographer who works in a photo studio. He is not satisfied with his salary and it's difficult for him to meet the requirements of his family. He decided to open his own photo studio but due to lack of funds he cannot do this.

So to help her husband open his own photo studio, Mrs. S. is requesting an Rs 10000.00 loan.

loans.use: To open photo studio

loans.name: Farid Ahammd

texts.en:
Farid Ahammd is married. He is uneducated and has a small catering shop. He has been involved in this business for more than 8 years and has a good number of customers in the area. He is supporting his family with this business but he is unable to complete his stock.

When he found AFSG in Afghanistan he requested an individual loan. He wants to expand his business with this loan to make a good monthly income to help his family and become strong in his business.

Ahammd is happy with this loan. He wishes to take more loans after finishing this loan to open another catering shop. He would like to thank AFSG and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Allah Mir

texts.en:
Allah Mir is married and lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. Mir was in the military for a long time. When he left the army he opened a retail shop. He wants to expand his business so he wants to take out an individual loan to complete his stock.

Mir wishes improve his business with this loan and he wants to open anther retail shop in the future. He is a very hard worker and has a lots of customers. He is happy with this loan and he would like to thank both AFSG and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Farkhanda

texts.en:
Farkhanda is married. She is educated woman who has a beauty parlor. She has good experience. She was working in her home before the Taliban regime and her business was very strong. But during the Taliban regime she lost everything and left Afghanistan. When she came back 4 years ago she started her business in Kabul and she is still working in her home.

Farkhanda requested an individual loan to open a shop and acquire some necessary materials to attract more clients and make her business strong and popular as it was in the past.

She is very happy with this loan process. She would like to expand her business in the next few years she wants to thank Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To open a shop and acquire some materials

loans.name: Mohammad Madi

texts.en:
M. Madi lives with is own family. He is married with 4 children. Madi is uneducated. He couldn't complete his education because of the war in Afghanistan. Now he tries very hard to educate his children. He is a taxi driver and works around Kabul.

Madi has 9 years experience in driving but he wants to replace his car. He has requested an individual loan from AFSG to replace his car and improve his business.

He is happy with this loan process and he wishes to become stronger in his business to enroll his children in a better school in Kabul. He would like to thank Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To replace his car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a large quantity of materials and products for a small beauty salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of shoes to replenish her stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothing to replenish a small store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to produce pastelitos.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of gasoline to retail in her community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cloth and other materials to keep running her activity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of use clothing to retail in her community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new fashionable clothing to add to her stock.

loans.name: Mayo B 2004-1 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Nura Sadeya. She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and vegetables at the market and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Nura is 40 years old and is married with a husband who is a policeman. She has 2 children aged 15 and 18 and her children go to school. Each week, Nura makes approximately 50 Sudanese pounds in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

Nura is joined in her small group by R. Sayama, Poni Susan, Labany R., and Mary Sammuel. R. Sayama has a business selling charcoal and wants to buy charcaol for sale. Poni Susan is currently operating a business selling cosmetics at a shop and wants a loan to open up restaurant. Labany R. operates a business selling charcoal and wants to open a clinic. Mary Sammuel is currently in the business of selling at a shop and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: Expand the business

loans.name: Chanphen

texts.en: Mr. Chanphen T. is a policeman in Prey Pouch Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. His wife, Mrs. Srey Nheob Seng, is employed in a garment factory. They have three children who are all attending school. Although Mr. Chanphen T. and his wife do business activities, they still live in an old house in poor conditions. In order to improve their standard of living, Mr. Chanphen T. has decided to build a new house. Thus, Mr. Chanphen T. is asking for a loan to hire house construction workers to build his house and replace the old one. His wife is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To hire construction workers to replace his house

loans.name: Somaly

texts.en: Mrs. Somaly P. is a grocer in Tie Prumpie Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Previously, Mrs. Somaly P. obtained a loan to start her current business. Because her business is doing well, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods in order to expand her business. Her husband, Mr. Ponara Bou, is a construction worker. Mrs. Somaly P. is 39 and is the mother of six children, two of whom help their mother while three others are enrolled in school. The youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods

loans.name: Thi Kim's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. T. thi Kim was born in 1962. She wants to borrow 3,604,000 VND (equivalent to 215 USD) to buy wood for her son to carve at home. Her husband is a communal police officer, who gets a very consistent source of income. Mrs. Kim works all day in the steel factory. During free time, she helps her son in his carving factory. On average, her family income is about 4,500,000 VND (equivalent to 265 USD) per month. Microfinance institutions such as TYM Fund allow Mrs. Kim to have small repayments. This is one idea that Mrs. Kim likes the most because it helps her to save more. Mrs. Kim's group includes:

T. Thi Xam (born in 1966), D. Thi Chinh (born in 1971), D. Thi Thong (born in 1960), and L. Thi Nghia (born in 1973), each wants to borrow 3,604,000 VND (equivalent to 215 USD) to invest in their wood carving business.

V. Thi Nghien (born in 1960) with the loan mount of 3,604,000 VND (equivalent to 215 USD) to sell chicken and eggs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva's Volunteer.

Trương Thị Kim, sinh năm 1962 (Ms 03070017), mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư làm đồ gỗ cho con trai làm tại nhà.Chồng chị là công an xã có lương ổn định, bản thân chị hàng ngày đi làm tại xưởng sắt. Những lúc nhàn rỗi, chị lại giúp con đục gọt tại xưởng gỗ. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 4.500.000 vnđ. Với những khoản vốn vay trả dần, chị rất thích vì giúp chị tiết kiệm tiền. Nhóm vay vốn của chị có sáu người đó là: Trương Thị Xâm, sinh năm 1966(Ms 03070018), mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư làm đồ gỗ. Đỗ Thị Chình, sinh năm 1971(Ms 03070022), mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư làm đồ gỗ. Đỗ Thị Thông, sinh năm 1960 (Ms 03070021), mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư làm đồ gỗ. Lê Thị Nghĩa, sinh năm 1973 (Ms 03070019), mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để kinh doanh đồ gỗ, Vương Thị Nghiên, sinh năm 1960 (Ms 03070020), mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để đi chợ gà, chợ trứng.

loans.use: sản xuất

loans.name: Zumrad

texts.ru:
Zumrad R. is a widow with two children. After her husband's death, she opened a store to help feed her children. The store still exists. Zumrad sells food. She wants to obtain a loan in order to increase the variety of items in her shop. It is located in a region close to the city center; therefore customers do not always have an opportunity to leave in to purchase goods. Zumrad's store gives them the opportunity to purchase goods in their town at affordable prices. Therefore, if Zumrad increases the number and variety of goods, this will help her increase her customer base and will also help people who live in the town. Zumrad plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Рахимова Зумрад вдова с двумя детьми. После смерти мужа открыла свой магазин для того , чтобы прокормить детей. Существует магазин и до сих пор. Торгует продуктами питания. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Ее магазин находится в населенном пункте далеко от центра, поэтому жители не всегда могут выезжать за товаром. Магазин Зумрад позволят им делать покупки прямо в своем кишлаке не выезжая по доступным ценам. Поэтому если она увеличит товарооборот и ассортимент товара это поможет ей привлечь новых клиентов , а так же поможет жителям кишлака. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase more goods

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru:
Matluba K. lives in the Shahrinav district with her son. She has been selling clothing for eight years. In anticipation of the upcoming school season sale, she wants to bring in seasonal goods. This is why she would like to obtain the loan. Matluba would use the loan to deliver school uniforms and other accessories. Following the school sale, the money will be in circulation until full repayment. Matluba would like to obtain a 12-month loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina, Kiva Volunteer.

Каюмова Матлюба жительница района Шахринау. Живет с сыном. Занимается торговлей одежды. Торгует уже восемь лет. В связи с сезоном школьной ярмарки хочет привезти сезонный товар. Для этого она обратилась к нам за кредитом. Получив кредит она завезет школьную форму и другие принадлежности.После окончания ярмарки деньги будут находится в обороте до полного погашения кредита. Срок на который Матлюба планирует получить кредит составляет 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Goods delivery

loans.name: Akbar

texts.ru:
Akbar K. is a businessman with 22 years of experience. He sells vegetables and fruits. He is married and has two children. Akbar plans to obtain the loan to increase goods circulation and subsequently make his business more profitable. Besides his business, Akbar works at a family farm, growing vegetables and selling the harvest for profit. He would use a portion of the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina, Kiva Volunteer.

Каюмов Акбар бизнесмен. Занимается бизнесом уже 22 года. Торгует овощами и фруктами. Женат , имеет двоих детей. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Это поможет увеличить прибыльность его дела. Кроме бизнеса он работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Выращивает овощи и получаемый урожай продает. Поэтому часть кредита использует на приобретение семян и удобрений

loans.use: To increase goods circulation

loans.name: Habiba

texts.ru:
Habiba A. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is married and has three children. She is a housewife and practices agriculture. She grows vegetables and sells the harvest at a market. Habiba leases a large plot of land and would like to obtain the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers and also to pay for the land lease. She can repay the loan within 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina, Kiva Volunteer.

Эшбуриева Хабиба Эргашевна жительница города Турсун-заде. Замужем и имеет троих детей. Домохозяйка , занимается сельским хозяйством. Сажает овощи , а получаемый урожай продает на базаре.Взяла в аренду большой участок земли и хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы купить семена и удобрения . А так же оплатить аренду земли. Погасить кредит сможет за 15 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Muhiddin

texts.ru:
Muhiddin B. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 48 years old, married and has two children. He is retired and practices animal husbandry. He owns a few sheep and goats. Currently, Muhiddin is planning to purchase a bull to raise and subsequently sell. He wants to obtain the loan for this purchase. He would like to then use the profit from selling the bull to buy a cow and grow his business. Muhiddin will be able to repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina, Kiva Volunteer.

Бобоев Мухиддин житель города Турсун-заде. Возраст 48 лет. Женат ,имеет двоих детей. Пенсионер . Занимается животноводством. Имеет хозяйство , где имеет несколько овец и коз. В данный момент планирует купить бычка для откормки и последующей перепродажи. Для этого он хочет получить кредит . Купив , молодого бычка и откормив его он сможет выгодно продать его и купить корову. Таким образом его дело будет развиваться . Погасить кредит он сможет в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en:
Nazira is married. She is 30 years old . She is a hard worker and a very talented woman. She worked before in embroidery but she couldn't support her family very well so she changed her business to tailoring. She is working with her hands; doesn’t have any machines.

She has requested an individual loan to buy a new machine and a generator for her business so she can work faster and grow this new business to make a good income for her family in the future.

Nazira is very happy to be able to ask for this loan. She hopes to enlarge her shop in the future to become stronger in her business and help her husband. Her husband is a taxi driver and she wants to support him. She would like to thank Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy a new machine and a generator

loans.name: Gulmahmad

texts.ru:
Gulmahmad S. lives in the Vakhsh district. He is 72 years old and married with three children. Despite his age, he practices animal husbandry, weaves ropes for animals and makes horse saddles and other necessary accessories. Gulmahmad sells completed merchandise at a market. He wants to purchase materials specifically for his business to help guarantee uninterrupted work. Continued business would only be possible with a loan of $450.00 (1500.00 TJS). He would like to repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina, Kiva Volunteer.

Сайтиев Гулмахмад житель Вахшского района. Возраст 72 года. Женат и имеет троих детей. Не смотря на возраст занимается животноводством , а так же плетет веревки для животных и производит седла для лошадей и другие необходимые принадлежности. Именно для этого бизнеса хочет закупить материал . Это поможет ему обеспечить бесперебойную работу. Готовую продукцию продает на рынке. Все это возможно лишь получив кредит в размере 1500 сомони. Срок на который он хочет взять кредит 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Kurbonoy

texts.ru:
Kurbonoy A. lives in the Vakhsh district. She is 40 years old and married with five children. Her family is large, and, to support it, she engaged in the business of selling cattle. Kurbonoy wants to obtain a loan in order to grow her business and to purchase another bull. She will be able to repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina, Kiva Volunteer.

Арзиева Курбоной проживает в районе Вахш. Возраст 40 лет ,замужем и имеет пятерых детей.Семья большая , поэтому для того , чтобы прокормить семью она занялась торговлей крупно- рогатого скота.Для развития бизнеса хочет получить кредит и купить еще одного бычка. Погашать кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Nasriddin

texts.ru:
Nasriddin H. lives in Vakhsh district. He's 50 years old, married, and has eight children. He has been farming for 10 years. He plants carrots on his land and then transports his harvest to Dushanbe city, where he sells it wholesale. His harvest has now ripened, but he doesn't have the means for collecting and transporting it. He would like to take out a loan for six months to enable him to collect and transport his goods properly.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer.

Хасанов Насриддин житель района Вахш . Возраст 50 лет. Женат , имеет 8 детей. Занимается земледелием уже десять лет. Сеет морковь на своем участке земли. Получаемый урожай продает оптом , привозя его в город Душанбе. Сейчас поспел урожай , а на его сбор и транспортировку не хватает средств.Поэтому он решил получить кредит сроком на 6 месяцев.Это поможет ему своевремено реализовать товар без ущерба.

loans.use: Transporting carrots

loans.name: Rozigul

texts.ru:
Rozigul G. lives in Vakhsh district. She is 37 years old, married, and has four children. She is a trader, bringing clothes from Dushanbe city and selling them at the Vakhsh district market. She would like to increase her stock turnover so that she can lower the prices of her goods. This would help her increase the volume of her sales and draw in new customers. To do so, she plans to take out a loan and pay it back within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer.

Гумахмадова Рузигуль жительница района Вахш. Возраст 37 лет . Замужем , имеет четверых детей. Занимается торговлей. Привозит одежду из города Душанбе. А реализует на рынке района Вахш. Хочет увеличить товарооборот , для того , чтобы снизить цены на продаваемую продукцию. Это поможет увеличить объем продаж и привлечь новых клиентов. Для этого она планирует получить кредит и погасить его она сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase stock turnover

loans.name: Sharif

texts.ru:
Sharif S. is 60 and lives in Khuroson district. He works in his own store where he sells food. He would like to take out a loan to purchase a refrigerator, which would help him develop his business, enabling him to increase his assortment of goods and store perishable food products. He plans to repay his loan within three months.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer.

Шодиев Шариф житель района Хуросон . Возраст 60 лет . Работает в собственном магазаине по продаже продуктов питания. Хочет получить кредит для покупки холодильника. Это поможет развитию бизнеса , увеличить ассортимент товара , а так же хранению быстропортящийся продукции. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 3 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of a refrigerator

loans.name: Qurbonoy

texts.ru:
Qurbonoy B. lives in Khuroson district. She's married and has six children. She has a secondary school education. She produces dairy products, purchasing milk from local milk-producers, and makes kefir (a fermented milk drink), cottage cheese and sour cream. She would like to take out a loan to purchase a cream separator to process cream from milk. She plans to pay back the loan within five months.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer.

Бобокалонова Курбоной Тагойбековна жительница района Хуросон. Замужем и имеет шестерых детей.Образование среднее. Занимается производством кисло-молочных продуктов. Скупает молоко у населения , производит кефир , творого и сметану. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы купить сепаратор для отжима сливок. Погасить кредит планирует в течении пяти месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of a cream separator

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru:
Fotima A. is a resident of Qurgan-Tube city. She has a big family. She is married and has four children. She has a specialized-middle school education and was trained to be a nurse. She works as a nurse in a polyclinic. In addition, in her free time, she sells vegetables and has a stall in the city market. She brings products from small villages, buying directly from the farmers and selling at a reasonable price. She would like to take out a loan to increase her commodity turnover. She plans to pay back her loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer.

Ашурматова Фотима Шарифбоевна жительница города Курган-тюбе.имеет средне-специальное образование. По специальности медсестра. Работает медсестрой в поликлинике . Кроме того в свободное время занимается торговлей овощами. Имеет торговую точку на рынке города. Привозит товар из кишлаков , скупая у дехкан. Продает по более выгодной цене. Сейчас хочет увеличить товарооборот , путем получения кредита. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 10 месяцев.У Фотимы большая семья. Она замужем и имеет четверых детей.

loans.use: Increase commodity turnover

loans.name: Ahahdjon

texts.en:
Ahahdjon C. is 32 years old. He is married, and he is the loving father of five children. Ahahdjon is a farmer. He is physically strong, and he is a spiritual man. On a daily basis, he plows the land to the best of his ability. Thanks to his energy and high spirit, he has been able to support his family for 10 years and to provide his children with an education as well.

Specifically, Ahahdjon sows potatoes, onions, carrots, tomatoes, and cucumbers. Each year he grows a sufficient amount of crops to feed his family and to sell the balance for profit. At the same time, Ahahdjon raises cattle. In particular, he buys cattle at the market at a low price, feeds them, and later resells them at the same market for a higher price.

His business is the main source of income for Ahahdjon and his family, though he has been feeling more pressure in recent years to generate greater income because his dearest children are growing up and, as a result, the family's expenses are on the rise. Therefore, Ahahdjon is now requesting a loan in the amount of 3,000 Somoni ($900 USD) over a 9-month term. With the loan proceeds, he plans to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers for his farming business, and he will use a portion of the proceeds to pay the salaries of his hired seasonal workers. Ahahdjon thanks everyone for their support, and he promises to repay the loan in a timely manner. Please play an important role in the growth of Ahahdjon’s business by helping his cause.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer, and to pay the salaries of his seasonal workers.

loans.name: Karomat

texts.ru:
Karomat R. is a resident of Rudaki district. She's married and has a child. She embroiders cloth. To ensure smooth operation of her business, she would like to take out a loan to purchase beads and threads. She plans to repay the loan within 15 months. Her business brings in a decent income and so she is trying in any way possible to develop it.

Translation from the Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

Розикова Каромат жительница района Рудаки. Замужем , имеет одного ребенка. Занимается вышиванием ткани. Хочет получить кредит для закупки бисера и ниток. Это поможет ей обеспечит себя бесперебойной работой. Погашать кредит планирует в течении 15 месяцев. Ее дело приносит не плохой доход , поэтому она старается всячески его развивать.

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.en:
Khosiyat K. is 39 years old. She has been married for 20 years, and she has 4 children. Her husband works in Russia. Khosiyat and her husband raise their children with love, and they try to ensure that their children have everything they need as they grow older.

Khosiyat has been running her business for 11 years. Specifically, she sells fabrics for the national dresses and different kinds of items at her store, including the following: detergents, razors, hair products, creams, etc. Khosiyat is always very polite with her clients and she has great taste when it comes to clothing, so she can easily advise her customers as to which textiles they should choose for particular occasions.

Khosiyat is trying to have a wide range of goods on hand at her store so that she can meet the needs of her customers irrespective of their income levels. Therefore, Khosiyat hereby requests a loan in the amount of 800 Somoni ($250 USD) to order a new stock of fabrics. She would like to thank everybody for their support, and she promises to repay the loan in 4 months.

loans.use: To meet her customers' demands and to diversify her product line by purchasing additional goods

loans.name: Qimsahon

texts.ru:
Qimsahon R. lives in the Rudaki region. She is married and has two children. She embroiders fabric. Rolls of fabric are brought to her for custom orders, and Qimsahon buys beads and thread. She embroiders flowers with beads. Now she wants to get a loan to buy beads and thread. This way she can ensure that she can continue working. She will be able to pay off the loan in 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Розикова Кимсанхон жительница района Рудаки. Замужем и имеет двоих детей. Занимается вышиванием ткани. Приносят на заказ рулоны ткани , а Кимсанхон покупает бисер и нитки. Вышивает цветы бисером. Сейчас она хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить бисер и нитки. Таким образом она обеспечит себе работу. Погасить кредит смолжет в течение 15 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase Material

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.en:
T. Gavhar is 38 years old. She is married with four children. Almost all of her children are attend to school. For a long time Gavhar’s husband couldn’t find a job for himself and recently he left for Russia for earning. That is why currently Gavhar is the only bread-winner in the family. For 8 years already Gavhar is breeding the cattle. Currently she is breeding 2 cows. All Gavhar’s children are attended to this business and as you can see at the photo. Gavhar by herself wasn’t pictured, as at the day of our visit she was absent. Gavhar is dreaming to build a house with good materials, support her children’s studies and increase her cattle for the business.  
For this reason she requests 500 Somoni (150 USD). She will spend the loan for purchasing the cattle. Gavhar promises to pay the loan timely as she used to do with previous loan. She expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional cattle

loans.name: Mahmood

texts.en:
Mahmood is married. He is educated. He was in Pakistan for 7 years. While he was living in Pakistan, he worked in an ice cream shop. He has 7 years experience in his business. When he came back, he opened an ice cream shop in Kabul.

But he can’t complete his lease purchase, so he has requested an individual loan to complete his stock and further his business with more success so as to make good monthly income for his family and enroll his children in a better education in Kabul.

Mahmood is very happy about this process of loans in Afghanistan that helps poor people and helps people that come from different countries. He is happy with all members of his family.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Pardali

texts.en:
Pardali N. is 39 years old. He is married, and he has 4 children. His wife is a housekeeper. Thus, Pardali’s business is the main source of income for his family. Pardali works hard in order to make his children happy and to provide them with a good education. In his business, he grows and sells crops such as tomatoes, onions, potatoes, cucumbers, and carrots. In fact, he has worked in the agricultural industry for ten years, and over that time span he has gained a great deal of experience and a love for the land. At the same time, Pardali raises small cattle to later sell the animals in the market.

As it is now the beginning of the sowing season, Pardali is planning to sow onions, potatoes, and carrots. Therefore, he is seeking a loan in the amount of 3,000 Somoni ($900 USD) over a 9-month term to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds. In addition, a portion of the loan proceeds will be used to purchase small cattle. Pardali is counting on your help, and he expresses his deepest gratitude to everyone for their support.

loans.use: To capitalize on the sowing season by purchasing seeds and fertilizer and to expand his cattle-raising/selling business by purchasing cattle.

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.ru:
Umedjon B. lives in the Rudaki region. He is married and has two children. He sells automobile tires. He has been doing this for five years already. To increase sales, he wants to take out a loan for 15 months. He has a shop in the Sultoni Kabir market.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Баротов Умеджон житель района Рудаки. Женат , имеет двоих детей. Занимается торговлей автошин. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже пять лет. Для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот хочет получить кредит , сроком на 15 месяцев. Имеет торговую точку на рынке «Султони Кабир».

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru:
Dilafruz S. lives in the Rudaki region. She is not married. She lives with her parents. She studies at the Institute. When not studying, she uses her free time to sew national dresses. She sews at home. She wants to take out a loan to buy material. She can then sell pre-made dresses. She plans to pay off the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Сатторова Дилафруз проживает в районе Рудаки. Не замужем . Живет с родителями . Учится в Институте. Кроме учебы в свободное от работы время занимается пошивом национальных платьев. Шьет дома. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить материал . Готовые платья отдает на продажу. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase material

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru:
Firuza. T. lives in the Rudaki region. She lives with her parents and daughter. Since she has divorced her husband, she must work. She sews Tajik mattresses to sell. She buys material, and sells the finished product in the Sultoni Kabir market. She has been doing this work for one year. She wants to take out a loan for 12 months to purchase material.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Тагоймуродова Фируза проживает в районе Рудаки. Живет с родителями и дочкой. Из-за того , что она развелась с мужем ей пришлось занятся бизнесом. Шьет курпачи на продажу. Закупает материал , а готовую продукцию реализует на рынке « Султони Кабир». Заимается этим видом бизнеса один год. Хочет получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев для закупки материала.

loans.use: Purchase material

loans.name: Narkhol

texts.en:
Narkhol A. is 39 years old. She is a widow, and she has two children. Narkhol has never had anyone's assistance in helping her children get ahead, so for the past 11 years she has been working in the sales industry; more specifically, she sells fuel and lubricants. This line of business has been her only source of income to support and to educate her children, and it has not been easy for her to bear such responsibility for her family. Even so, the love she has for her children is what drives her forward from day to day. At present, her older son helps her with the business. 
Narkhol is now requesting a loan in the amount of 300 Somoni ($100 USD), the proceeds of which will be used to meet her clients' demands and to thereby increase her sales volume. She promises to repay the loan in 4 months. The well-being of this brave woman and her family is in your hands, so please help them by contributing to the growth of her business. They sincerely thank you for your support.

loans.use: To meet her customers' demands and to increase the business' sales by diversifying her product line through the purchase of additional goods

loans.name: Sayaad Hassan

texts.en:
Sayaad Hassan has a construction company. He is married and lives with his own family. Hassan has been involved in this business for more than 4 years. He has some good contracts but he needs money to expand his business so he wants to take out an individual loan.

He wants to expand and finish his work as soon as possible. Hassan is happy. He wishes to become stronger in his business in the future.

loans.use: To expand his construction business

loans.name: Khom

texts.en: Mrs. Khom B. and her husband, Mr. Puth Pok, are farmers in Tumnop Thmey Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Khom B. also owns a small rice mill which can turn husk-rice into rice for eating. Mrs. Khom B. has seven children, four of whom are attending school while the other three are too young to work or study. On her plantation, Mrs. Khom B. has a small problem because she does not have enough money to purchase fertilizers for her field. Therefore, she is requesting a loan for this purpose. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for her field

loans.name: Choeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Choeurn C. is a villager in Kosh Khtum Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a farmer and firewood-seller. Her rice revenue is currently too low because her rice field is small. She wants to expand her rice production so she is asking for a loan to buy a piece of land. Previously, Mrs. Choeurn C. obtained a loan to buy buffalos to plow her field. Mrs. Choeurn C. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land in order to cultivate rice

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Mom P. is a coal-seller in Kveth Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her business is going well and she wants to expand it. Thus, she is asking for a loan to purchase more coal to sell. Her husband, Mr. Yeon Srey, is a vegetable farmer. Mrs. Mom P. has six children who are all attending school. Currently, one of her children has dengue fever and Mrs. Mom P. spent $75 for medicines. This is the reason why she does not have enough money to buy coal. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase more coal to sell in the village

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of materials and sewing equipment

loans.name: Sami

texts.en: Mrs. Sami Y. and her husband, Mr. Thon Kok, are farmers in Tumnop Thmey Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Sami Y. is also a firewood seller and a pig breeder. She has two children who are too young to work or study. Her family lives in an old house. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Sami Y. is asking for a loan to add to the profit from her businesses to build a new house. Mrs. Sami Y., her husband and her son are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase stocks of medicine and a suction machine

loans.name: Thoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Thoeurn H. and her husband, Mr. Heon Ham, are farmers in Khnong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. They have five children, two of whom help their parents on their plantation while the other three are attending school. Mrs. Thoeurn H.’s field is now infertile so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer for her field. Recently, her husband became ill and she spent $125 to have H. cured. That’s why she is short of money now. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her field

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of chicken medicine, chicken feeds, and charcoal.

loans.name: Nareth

texts.en: Mrs. Nareth N. is a fruit seller in Tei Prumpie Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Previously, she obtained a loan to start her current business. Because Mrs. Nareth N.’s business is doing well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she is asking for a loan to purchase different kinds of fruit and increase her inventory. Mrs. Nareth N. is a 43-year-old widow with two children who are both attending school.

loans.use: To purchase different kinds of fruit and increase her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase stock of materials and sewing machine

loans.name: Sa

texts.en: Mrs. Sa O. Chea is a villager in Chambork Kantreanh Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She and her husband, Mr. Sitha Tuon, are garment factory workers. They are also farmers. They have two children who are too young to work or study. At present, Mrs. Sa O. Chea’s plantation has infertile soil. Thus, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer for her field in order to make it more productive. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to make her field more productive.

loans.name: Huoy

texts.en: Mrs. Huoy V. lives in Ra Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She sells Khmer cheese (Prohok) which is processed from small fish and it is used to give a nice flavor to Khmer soup in the local market. Mrs. Huoy V. is a widow with two children who are both attending school. Because the price of land is going up fast, Mrs. Huoy V. decided to ask for a loan to buy a piece of land for speculation.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land for speculation

loans.name: Protected

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 40 years old. She is married and has 3 children. One of them is studying at university. Her old and sick mother lives with them in a rented house. The entrepreneur has a small shop selling children's clothes, and she applied to borrow $1200 to purchase new clothes and goods for the shop, paint the shop, and make some advertising in order to increase her income and save for a better life for her family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new clothes and goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of chicken feed, chicks, medicine, and charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of more chickens and supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of more inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of more inventory for his General Store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of two machines and materials

loans.name: Sochea

texts.en: Mrs. Sochea R. is a vegetable-seller in Tie Prumpie Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Because her business is going well she wants to expand it. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy different kinds of vegetables to sell. With part of the loan she will also fix her house. Mrs. Sochea R. is a 37-year-old widow with a child who is attending school. Previously, Mrs. Sochea R. obtained a loan to buy rice. She has fully repaid that loan.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a planing machine and materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of two dairy cows

loans.name: Fawood

texts.en:
Fawood is married. He is educated. He has a retail shop. His wife is uneducated; she is a home worker and all his children are in school. He is supporting them. He would like to make a better income for his family to help better his family.

So Fawood wants to expand his business. He wants to take out an individual loan to complete his stock to attract more customers for his shop than the other shopkeepers in the area. He hopes to be one of the great business dealers in the future and make his shop a general store in the future. He would like to thank lenders.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Thong

texts.en:
Mr. Thong B. is a motorcycle taxi driver, and he earns approximately $1.70 per day. He is married with three children, and he and his family live in the Andong Sambour Village in Pursat Province. His wife is a farmer in addition to her duties of cooking and caring for the family.

Because Mr. B.’s motorcycle is old and frequently breaks down, he is requesting a loan to purchase a new motorcycle. In practice, the loan proceeds would allow him to generate greater income for the benefit of his family because a new motorcycle would drastically improve his motorcycle taxi service. More specifically, a new motorcycle would look nicer and would thus attract more customers; at the same time, a new motorcycle would require less maintenance and would thereby cut down on expenses to repair his motorcycle.

loans.use: To improve his business by purchasing a new motorcycle

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.ru:
Shoyeva Dilafruz lives in Yavan. She is 26 years old. She is married and has two children. She works in sales. She sells vegetables and fruit. She wants to take out a loan to increase turnover and the assortment of goods in her inventory. It will help her to increase sales volume and to increase her profit. She plans to pay off the loan in 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Шоева Дилафруз жительница города Яван. Возраст 26 лет. Замужем и имеет двоих детей.Занимается бизнесом в сфере торговли. Продает овощи и фрукты. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить товарообороти ассортимент товара. Это поможет увеличить объем продаж и увеличить прибыльность дела. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Sort

texts.en:
Mrs. Sort S. sells sweets and fruits in her village market in the Tramses Village of Pursat Province. She is a widow, and she lives with her one daughter. In fact, her daughter (pictured) helps her to sell her goods.

Due to an increase in demand for her goods, she is now requesting a loan in the amount of $150 to purchase more ingredients (so that she can make sweets to sell) and fruits. In this way, the loan proceeds will enable her to sell more goods and to thereby increase her income.

loans.use: To meet the increase in demand for her goods by purchasing more fruits and other ingredients in order to make sweets to sell

loans.name: Mohammad Smail

texts.en:
Mohammad Smail is 47 years old, married, living in a household of 8 members. He has a retail shop and one of his sons is working with him. He was 22 years old when he started up his business and still he is working.

So he wants to buy some tanks of gas to start up gas selling. He has requested an individual loan to complete his stock and make new section for gas inside his shop. He has 200,000 Afghani (about US$ 4350) retail value in his shop. Now he wants to take a loan in the amount of 50,000 Afghani (US$ 1,100) with a term of 18 months to further these two businesses. He hopes to further enlarge his business in the future.

loans.use: To complete his stock and make new section for gas

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru:
Matluba G. lives in Yavan. She is a housewife. She takes care of a household which includes calves. In order to make and sell sour dairy products, she wants to buy a milk cow. It will give her the chance to use the milk and to sell it for low prices. To do this, she needs 4,000 somoni. Therefore she plans to take out a loan for 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Грезова Матлюба жительница города Яван. Домохозяйка. Разводит домашнее хозяйство , где имеет бычков. Для производства и продажи кисло-молочных продуктов хочет купить корову для того , чтобы получать молоко. Это даст возможность использовать молоко и продавать продукцию по низким ценам. Но для этого необходимы деньги в размере 4000 сомони. Поэтому он планирует получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Buying a milk cow

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.ru:
Muhammad H. is a resident of Vahdat city. He is married with four children. He works as a farmer and has a farm where he raises bull-calves. To increase his turnover, he would like to take out a loan and purchase an additional bull, which will help him develop his business as well as get additional income which he needs to support his family. He will pay off his loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva volunteer.

Хасанов Мухаммад житель города Вахдат . Женат , имеет четверых детей. Работает фермером. Имеет хозяйство , где разводит бычков. Для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот хочет получить кредит и купить еще одного бычка. Это поможет развивать его бизнес .А так же получать дополнительные доходы так необходимые его семье. Прогасить кредит планирует в течении 10 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Waris

texts.en:
Waris G. H. is one of the residents of the Ningarhar province. He and his family have recently returned to their homeland Afghanistan from 20 years of immigration in Pakistan. Like many other returnee families, the household faced various financial problems initially. They didn’t have enough money to rebuild their destroyed house and start a business. But Waris had the guts to accept all the difficulties and borrow some money from one of his friends to make a small retail shop.

Waris is still working on that shop and he was able to repay the loan in one year. Definitely, Waris is an unread guy but he is a clever and active man. He thinks about his small brothers' future and he says that he will never let them stop their studying. Waris hopes to offer doctors to society from his family.

For achieving those high-aimed goals, Waris is thinking about improving his business. He wants to make a bigger shop and purchase enough materials to increase the number of his customers. It certainly seems like he can definitely achieve this goal because his shop is in the central location of the bazaar. Therefore, he has requested from AFSG a loan in the amount of 30,000 Afghanis (US$ 650) for 18 months.

loans.use: To buy enough materials for his shop

loans.name: Pol

texts.en:
Mrs. Pol S. (pictured with her daughter) sells groceries from her house, and in doing so she earns approximately $2 per day. Her husband has been working as a construction worker for the past 28 years, and he earns approximately $2.50 per day. They have four children, two of whom are married and two of whom live in the family home.

Because of increasing family expenses, Mrs. Soerun wants to purchase a motorcycle so that one of her sons can supplement the family's income by working as a motorcycle-taxi driver. Accordingly, she is hereby requesting a loan in the amount of $900 to purchase a motorcycle for her son to drive.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle so that her son can work as a motorcycle-taxi driver

loans.name: Gulruhon

texts.ru:
Gulruhon D. is a resident of Fayzabad district. She is married and has four children. She is a homemaker and works the land around her home where she grows fruits and raises goats. She would like to get a loan to purchase cattle for milk and to provide her family with dairy products. She will pay back the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva volunteer.

Давлатова Гулрухон жительница района Файзабад. Замужем , имеет четверх детей. Домохозяйка . Занимается домашним хозяйством . где имеет участок земли, фрукты и Коз. Сейчас хочет получить кредит и использовать его на приобретение Крупно-рогатого скота.Это проможет ей получать молоко и обеспечить семью кисло-молочными продуктами. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 12 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Ezzat-Ullah

texts.en:
Ezzat-ullah, son of S. N., is a hardworking man but he's still struggling with economic difficulties surrounding him. He is 23 and single and he has the responsibility of supporting six other members of his family.

After graduating from high school, Ezzat wanted to go to college but the financial conditions of his household did not allow him to do so. He had to take the responsibility of supporting his family and therefore he opened a retail store.

Ezzat-ullah was 18 when he started the business; however he did not have a lot of experience but always had the motivation to work and support his family. First he made a small shop which didn’t have many things. But the shop was in a good location and before long he attracted a lot of customers. In order to expand his business, he borrowed some money from one of his friends and made some new shelves in his shop. He has repaid that loan but he wants to buy a freezer for his shop to keep juices or other beverages cold enough so as not to lose his loyal customers. Ezzat-ullah has, therefore, applied to AFSG for a loan in the amount of 50,000 Afghanis (US$ 1,100).

Ezzat-ullah hopes that through improving his business by getting this freezer, he will be able to increase his profitability. He dreams of restarting his education and becoming an engineer. He also wants to make a bright future for his younger siblings.

loans.use: To buy a freezer for his shop

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sin R. makes and sells Cambodian noodles and porridge in her village. By doing so, she is able to earn approximately $5 per day. She is a widow, and she lives with her one son in the Phnom Prasat Village of Banteay Meanchey province. Her son is a motorcycle taxi driver whose income can support the majority of the family’s expenses.

Nevertheless, Mrs. R. wants to commence a new business whereby she will sell fruit. Therefore, she is now requesting a loan in the amount of $800 to purchase various fruits to sell to her customers. In addition, any remaining loan proceeds will be used to purchase a second-hand motorcycle in order to transport the fruit that she is hoping to sell. In this way, the loan would allow her to expand her business and to thereby pay for her family’s expenses.

loans.use: To embark upon a new fruit-selling business by purchasing fruit and a second-hand motorcycle to transport such fruits to the market to sell

loans.name: Rith

texts.en:
Mrs. Rith T. is a farmer in the Bakpring Village of Pursat Province. She lives with her husband and their three children. Two of her children are bricklayers, and they each earn approximately $2 per day. Meanwhile, T. grows rice on her farmland, and she is able to earn approximately $1 per day.

Because of increasing demand for her rice, she is now seeking a loan in the amount of $150 to purchase fertilizer. In turn, the fertilizer will help her increase her yield and will thereby increase her income for the benefit of her entire family.

loans.use: To increase her rice yield by purchasing fertilizer

loans.name: Qiyomiddin

texts.ru:
Qiyomiddin D. is a resident of Fayzabad district where he lives with his family. He is married and has two children. He has been in business for seven years. At this time, he would like to redecorate his store facilities and would like to take out a loan to do so. This would help him to create the conditions to draw in new customers. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva volunteer.

Давлатов Киемиддин житель района Файзабад. Живет вместе со своей семьей . Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Бизнесом занимается уже 7 лет. В данный момент хочет сделать ремонт помещения. Но для этого он должен получить кредит. Это поможет создать условия , которые смогут привлечь новых клиентов.Погасить кредит он планирует в течегнии 12 месяцев

loans.use: Redecoration

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Mrs. Men T. is a 34-year-old widow, and she sells cooked rice with pork and chicken in her area market. On average, she earns approximately $5 per day. She has three children, and she and her children live in the Chrang Chamres Village of Phnom Penh City.

Fortunately, her business has been growing, and there has been an increase in demand from her customers. Accordingly, she is requesting a loan in the amount of $500 to purchase more grocery products to sell to her customers. In addition, any remaining loan proceeds will be used by Mrs. T. to decorate her store in order to attract even more customers. In this way, the loan will allow her to expand her business and to generate greater income for her family.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by increasing her inventory and by decorating her store

loans.name: Amriya

texts.ru:
Amirya D. is a resident of Fayzabad district, where she lives with her family. She is married and had five children. In the center of her village, she has a store where she sells hardware. She would like to increase her turnover by taking out a loan that will help her increase her variety of goods and draw in new customers. She plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva volunteer.

Давлатова Амрия жительница района Файзабад. Живет со своей семьей . Она замужем и миеет пятерых детей. В центре кишлака имеет магазин. Торгует промышленными товарами. Хочет увеличить товарооборот путем получения кредита.Это поможет ей увеличить ассортимент товара и привлечь новых клиентов.Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Goods delivery

loans.name: Kokou  Jules

texts.fr:
Born on 12 April 1971 in Agbanakin in Togo, Mr. Kokou Jules M. is married and has four people in his care. A farmer by profession for thirteen years, he specializes in the cultivation of maize and manioc. However, the income drawn from these crops no longer allows him to meet the needs of his family.

Therefore, he has decided to take advantage of the benefits of a limitless stream of water which crosses his village, by growing sugarcane and okra.

This activity will allow him to realize a decent profit in order to meet the needs of his family. For this, he is requesting a loan.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Né le 12 avril 1971 à Agbanakin au Togo, Monsieur M. Kokou Jules est marié et a à sa charge quatre personnes. Agriculteur de profession depuis treize ans, il s’est spécialisé dans la culture de maïs et de manioc. Mais les revenus issus de ces productions ne lui permettent plus de répondre aux besoins de sa famille.

C’est ainsi qu’il décide de profiter des atouts d’un cours d’eau intarissable qui traverse son village en produisant de la canne à sucre et de gombo.

Cette activité lui permettra de dégager un bénéfice conséquent pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Pour la réaliser, il sollicite un crédit.

loans.use: To buy sugarcane seedlings and okra seeds

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Born in 1973 in Agbanakin in Togo, Mr. Kodjo K. is a very dynamic and dedicated carpenter. He is married and has six children. The profit he derives from his carpentry business being no longer able to help him meet the various household expenses, he has decided to diversify his sources of income.

For this, he is asking for a loan to buy and raise pigs and goats with a view to increase his income and improve the living conditions of the members of his family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Né en 1973 à Agbanakin au Togo, Monsieur K. Kodjo est un menuisier très dynamique et très dévoué. Il est marié et est père de six enfants. Le bénéfice qu’il dégage de son activité de menuiserie ne lui permettant plus de faire face aux multiples charges familiales, il décide de diversifier ses sources de revenus.

Pour cela, il sollicite un crédit pour acheter et élever des porcs et chèvres dans la perspective d’augmenter ses revenus et d’améliorer les conditions de vie des membres de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy and raise pigs and goats

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru:
Dilshod D. is a resident of Fayzabad district. He is 30 years old, married, and has two children. He teaches in a middle school. He also sells muskmelons and watermelons. He has a stand from which he sells them on the main street of Fayzabad. He would like to take out a loan in the amount of 1500 somoni to increase his turnover. He plans to pay it back within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva volunteer.

Давлатов Дильшод житель района Файзабад. 30 лет , женат и имеет двоих детей. Работает учителем в средней школе.Кроме того занимается торговлей дынь и арбузов. Имеет торговую точку ц главной дороге Файзабада.Хочет получить кредит в размере 1500 сомони для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Goods delivery

loans.name: Anvarjon

texts.ru:
Anvarjon T. lives in Tursun-zoda city. He is married with four children. He has a higher education and is a professional mechanic. He works in his own store where he sells building materials and has done so for the last 16 years. He would like to increase his product assortment with a loan, which he plans to pay off in 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva volunteer.

Тоштемиров Анварджон проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Женат , имеет четверых детей. Имеет высшее образование. По профессии механник. Работает в своем магазине по продаже строй материалов. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 16 лет. Хочет увеличить ассортимент товара , путем получения кредита. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 15 месяцев.

loans.use: Goods delivery

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 31-year-old Prisca K., who is married and has no children. In 2007, Prisca established her salon business in which she is assisted by her two employees. Prisca now requests a loan in order to expand her range of haircare products and wigs. In the future, she plans to open another business. Prisca thanks you for your support.

Hair, hair and more hair! This is the place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or plaited, and made to look like your own.

loans.use: To expand her range of hair care products and wigs.

loans.name: Koami Sylvain

texts.fr:
Born on 20 February 1965, Mr. Koami Sylvain T. is married and has five people in his care. He ensures the minimum needs of his family thanks to the meagre monthly revenue he draws from the sale of petrol, an activity he has pursued for five years.

To increase his income in order to improve his family's standard of living, he is asking for a loan. This amount will allow him to increase his purchasing power and will serve as the working capital required to secure and maximize his income.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Né le 20 février 1965 Monsieur T. Koami Sylvain est marié et a cinq personnes à charge. Il assure le minimum vital à sa famille grâce au maigre revenu mensuel qu’il tire du commerce de pétrole ; profession qu’il exerce depuis cinq ans.

Pour accroître son revenu afin d’améliorer les conditions et niveau de vie de sa famille, il sollicite un crédit. Ce fonds lui permettra d’augmenter son pouvoir d’achat et lui servira de fonds de roulement nécessaire à la sécurisation et à la maximisation de son revenu.

loans.use: To buy equipment and petrol

loans.name: Rahel

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Rahel M., who is married and has four children aged between 10 and 22. She has two additional dependents who live with her because they are attending school in the area. In 2007, Rahel established her traditional African cloth business. Working five days a week, eight hours a day, she earns about $90 every month. She now requests a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of traditional African cloth in bulk. In the future, Rahel plans to open another business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of traditional African cloth.

loans.name: Mastura

texts.ru:
Mastura U. lives in the Fayzabad District. She works in a department store, where she has her own sales counter. She sells shoes, children's and women's clothing. She has already been in this business for 26 years. She wants to increase her sales turnover and by doing that diversify the variety of goods she sells. Additionally, the school shopping season is coming, and she would like to bring in goods before it starts. To do this she decided to take out a 15-month loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Юсупова Мастура проживает в районе Файзабад. Работает в Универмаге. Имеет свой прилавок . где продает обувь, детскую и женскую одежду. Занимается этим бизнесом уже 26 лет. Хочет увеличить товарооборт и таким образом разнообразить ассортимент товара. К тому же наступил сезон школьной ярмарке и к ее началу хочет завести товар. Для этого она планируетполучить кредит сроком на 15 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase sales turnover

loans.name: Martin

texts.fr:
Born on 6 June 1971 in Aklakou in Togo, Mr. Martin Y. is a very dynamic and dedicated electronic engineer. However, he lacks the funds to open a workshop. He is married and has four people in his care, whose needs he meets thanks to the meagre income he draws from traditional rearing of poultry and small ruminants.

WIth the goal of increasing his income in order to improve the living conditions of his family, he is asking for a loan to open an electronics workshop and to sell electronic accessories.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Né le 06 juin 1971 à Aklakou au Togo, Monsieur Y. Martin est un électronicien très dynamique et dévoué. Cependant il manque de fonds pour ouvrir un atelier de travail. Il est marié et a la charge de quatre personnes dont il subvient aux besoins grâce au faible revenu qu’il tire de l’élevage traditionnel de volailles et de petits ruminants.

Dans la perspective d’accroître son revenu aux fins d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille, il sollicite un crédit pour ouvrir un atelier électronique et pour vendre des accessoires électroniques.

loans.use: To set up and equip his workshop

loans.name: Yasinta

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 49-year-old Yasinta K., who is married and has two children aged 18 and 28. In 2000, Yasinta established her milk business. Working six days a week, ten hours a day, and assisted by her children, she earns about $130 every month from this business. She now requests a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of milk and vessels for carrying milk. In the future, Yasinta plans to open another business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of milk.

loans.name: Lívia Trindade

texts.pt:
Lívia Trindade P. is 33 years old and is from Chibuto in the province of Gaza in the South of Mozambique. She is married and has 3 sons - the eldest two are 3 year old twins and the youngest is only 30 days old. Lívia only has her children to support.

Lívia was in school until the 12th grade but had to stop as her school timetable was not compatible with her work schedule, seeing as she was already working whilst doing her final few grades. Lívia grew up in the city of Maputo and her job was at Cimentos de Moçambique (Cements of Mozambique), later having a contract with the Youth Board for 2 years. She lives in a rented house and is currently building her own house with the use of loans.

Lívia has been working as a Logistics administrator for Procredito for 2 years and works from 8am to 5pm every day with a one hour break. She learnt how to perform her function primarily at Cimentos de Moçambique and from some other institutions she has been in. She has a monthly salary of 14000,00 MZN and saves 8000,00 MZN a month.

This is Lívia's first loan, having heard of Hluvuku through friends. Her great dream in life is to own her own house so she can stop renting and being dependent on someone else for her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Inês Teles, Kiva volunteer.

Lívia Trindade P. tem 33 anos de idade, natural de Chibuto província de Gaza ao sul de Moçambique. Casada maritalmente e mãe de 3 filhos, os dois primeiros são gemeos e tem 3 anos e o ultimo tem 30 dias. Lívia não sustenta ninguém para alem dos seus filhos.

Lívia estudou até 12ªclasse e parou por incompatibilidade do seu horário de trabalho uma vez que os últimos níveis fez ja trabalhando. Lívia cresceu na cidade de Maputo e o seu emprego foi na Cimentos de Moçambique, e mais tarde veio a ter um contrato com Direção da Juventude por dois anos. Vive numa casa de aluguer e neste momento atraves dos empréstimos está a construir sua casa.

Lívia é funcionária da Procredito como administrativa da Logistica a dois anos e tem um Horário das 8 as 17h por dia com uma interopção de uma hora. Aprendeu a exercer tais tarefas primeiramente na cimentos de Moçambique e em outras instituições que passo nelas. Tem um salário mensal de 14000,00mt e poupa mensalmente 8000,00mt.

Para Lívia este é o seu primeiro empréstimo e conheceu a Hluvuku atraves dos colegas. Tem como grande sonho na vida dela é ter sua casa própria para parar de aluguer casa e depender de alguem.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials with which to build a house for her family.
